Title: Huli Vesha, Yakshagana and rap songs: This college fest was all about diversity
Content: Power-packed performances by students, musicians and other artistes set the tone for the 2020 edition of Cultura, CMR Institute of Technology’s annual fest. Apart from the traditional dance shows, performances by indie artistes like DJane Da Queen and MC Bijju and Rahul Dit-O set the stage on fire at the fest. And that’s not all. Celebrities like Jayaram Karthik, Angana Roy, Advithi and Ashvithi Shetty and Arundathi Hegde graced the occasion with their presence and were even spotted interacting with the students, as part of the ‘Coffee with Cultura’ event. One of the highlights of the fest was a representation of Huli Vesha and Yaskshagana performances by the students, while others took part in activities like paintball, fashion show, food hunt and more.

Title: Vinay Forrt: 2020 will be a game changer for me: Vinay Forrt
Content: There is hope, confidence and contentment in Vinay Forrt ’s voice. His upcoming films will bring a twist to his acting journey, he tells us. He is effusive about his character David in Malik and excited about essaying the lead role in Lijo Jose Pellisserry ’s next, Churuli.In his Fort Kochi slang, the Thamaasha actor says that people who still identify him as Java from 2015-movie Premam would now get a shocker. “There is a dark side in every human, and Malik and Churuli will show another side of my acting,” says Vinay, as he joins us for a candid chat.It is a movie that actually said aloud the things that are usually said between two people. The film revolves around an event and every character in it is integral. It is a director's film and Shambu Purushothaman is someone with a strong point of view. Unfortunately, it did not do so well in theatres, maybe because the team didn't know how to market it well. I am sure that it will be celebrated once it comes on television or online.I play David; he is the second lead to Fahadh's titular role, Suleiman Malik. David is a real-life character, who lived in Thiruvananthapuram. The movie is inspired by a true incident. David is very close to my heart and the favourite among the characters I have played so far, because it is very different from anything I have done.It is a meaty role. It is a story about the survival of the people in the coastal area. David is a grey character, moving to the darker side, and the film explains why. He is loud and it was physically challenging for me to essay him, as well. I have four get ups in the movie and made changes in my body language and looks.The story goes through the character’s life from his 20s to his mid-50s. To prepare for the role, I did not take up any films for almost six months and the shooting went on for five months.After Take Off, I always wanted to do a Mahesh Narayanan movie. Mahesh has a vision about the movie and he gets what he wants.Of course. I grew up watching fishermen in Fort Kochi so the characters in the film were familiar to me. I was able to relate with their body language and the way the drape their lungis. David is raw and not at all sophisticated. Also, I was able to give a high tempo to his voice, and it is like this for 90% of the film. I have never played up the drama so much in any of my films. It is a blessing for an actor to have such dramatic characters. I usually internalise to get into character, here I was able to externalise as well.Jis is a very good friend of mine and Mikacha Nadan Mohankumar is a feel-good movie. In the industry, we jokingly call him the new-gen Sathyan Anthikad. Like Jis' other films, this is filled with goodness and everybody will enjoy it. The film has three important characters, essayed by Siddique, Kunchacko Boban and myself.My character, Aghosh Menon represents new-gen actors. He has only done four films, all of which were superhits and the film portrays his struggles with managing his sudden fame. It belongs to realistic comedy genre. For me Mikacha Nadan Mohankumar and Malik, almost shows me at two ends of the spectrum.Churuli was my bucket list tick as I had always wished that I should act in at least one of Lijo chettan's films ever since I saw City of God. Now, I can boast of having the lead role in Thamaasha, which was bankrolled by him and his directorial, Churuli. All this happened because of Chemban chettan ( Chemban Vinod Jose ), who suggested my name for these films. Lijo chettan is a different kind of filmmaker. We completed our shoot in 19 days. It has a superb screenplay by S Hareesh based on Vinoy Thomas ’ story.Malik and Churuli are very important for me, as post Thamaasha the scripts that came to me were all about the problems faced by a regular, simple guy and the characters where cliched. I had rejected many of these offers. These two films mark a different genre of grey characters.I am sure after the release of these films, the comments like ‘De da Java ponu’, ‘Eda Java’ will change. 2020 will be special in my acting life, which I began in my classroom at the age of four. Going by how it has gone so far, I know this year will be a game changer for me. It will showcase my favourite roles and my best films.

Title: 777 charlie: 777 Charlie’s pooches on pan-India road trip
Content: Team 777 Charlie has been busy travelling all around the country, and wrapping up one schedule after another. Speaking to us from Amritsar, director Kiranraj K shares, “We are currently shooting in Punjab, which is part of a 15-day schedule that includes other locations such as Gujarat and Rajasthan. With this, we complete close to 65% of the film, and will head back to Bengaluru. In April, the team will travel to Kodaikanal, Shimla, and conclude at Kashmir. We are looking at wrapping up the shoot by the first week of May.” This travel-heavy schedule might seem daunting to many, and here’s a good place to remind you that an adorable dog is at the crux of this movie’s narrative. And the team is working round-the-clock to ensure that the pooches playing the canine protagonist are properly pampered. “In all, three ‘Charlies’ travel with us. We’ve had them since they were puppies. Even prior to the shoot, we would take them on outings, so that they get accustomed to travelling. And they absolutely love it! The moment the shot is ready, and the main pup that plays Charlie spots the vehicle that she and Rakshit Shetty ’s character in the film travel, she jumps straight into the side car, raring to go,” shares Kiranraj. Apart from this, the team has also transformed a car into an air-conditioned caravan for the dogs to chill in. “Each location has varying climatic conditions. So, to ensure that the dogs don’t bear the brunt of it, the caravan is set up at the location before the dogs are flown in with us,” he adds.Given that the Coronavirus scare is a concern for any traveller, across the country and the world, this movie team is alert and keeping a close eye on the news. “All the primary safety measures are in place. We are equipped with masks and have basic medical kits. We are staying up-to-date on the news, keeping note of where the cases are cropping up, and altering our schedules accordingly. For instance, recently, few cases were recorded near Bikaner, Rajasthan, and we changed our travel plans promptly. We are adapting on the go, and, thankfully, everyone has remained hale and hearty,” the filmmaker signs off.

Title: My freedom of expression is non-negotiable: Huma Qureshi
Content:
Huma Qureshi was in Bengaluru recently, attending the ET Power Icons ceremony as the chief guest. The actress, who considers namma ooru as her second home and has many close friends here – including golfer Anisha Padukone, who she calls her ‘chotu sister’ – got chatty with Bangalore Times about the importance of freedom of expression in the country today, the growing love for Indian cinema abroad and more. Excerpts:

Many actors hold back from expressing their views, but you don’t. What does it take to put forth your unfiltered opinion?

In a democratic nation, there should be absolute freedom of expression. It is non-negotiable. Whatever I am today is because of my parents and my country. If someone says anything against either, or if there is something happening in the nation which is not right, I will raise my voice. I don’t think that has got anything to do with being brave or bold. Of course, I’m primarily an artiste and not an activist, but, as a public figure, I feel that we should express our views.



Moving to cinema, Oscar-winning movie Parasite has proved that subtitles can be a game-changer for good content. Your thoughts on that...

A film with subtitles bagging the Oscars only proves that a good film is a good film. Cinema is a medium that transcends language barriers, as it can form an emotional connect with the audience. And that’s the new norm. It’s a welcome trend because, we are finally talking about diversity in its truest sense, as opposed to tokenism.Currently, there is a lot of curiosity around Indian content in the international market. And this includes actors, stories and the storytellers. We have such an amazing gold mine of cultures and stories, and the world is yet to experience that. I feel there is a change in the landscape of storytelling, too. Now, we have a lot more local language content coming out. I would like to see a Kannada or a Bengali show made really well that have the potential to travel around the world. We watch Spanish shows and never for a moment think it is local-language content that we are watching. I really think that our stories too can make an impact globally.Yes, of course. Content is king, and great writing has to be the priority. We still largely function from a star-led system. But, fortunately, that is changing now. It is all about good storytelling these days.I’ve always tried to pick films that make me happy. I’ve never thought about whether or not a particular movie is mainstream. I’ve made the best of the opportunities that I have got. For instance, if there is an offer from the Tamil film industry and I like it, I will take it up. Same will be the approach to an offer from the West. I think of myself as a gypsy – who travels, pitches a tent, performs and then returns home.

Title: Kavin, Amritha Aiyer play techies in this horror-thriller
Content: Chennai Times Most Desirable Man On Television 2019 Kavin will be teaming up with Bigil girl Amritha Aiyer for a horror-thriller. Titled Lift , the film is being directed by debutant Vineeth.Kavin says, “Once I came out of Bigg Boss Tamil house, I got to listen to this script. I just looked at what’s in the script and it really excited me. I heard it from an audience point of view and found that it is an interesting edge-of-the-seat thriller. Both Amritha and I play IT professionals in the film. Vineeth is an ad-filmmaker, who is debuting as director with this film.”He says that there is one more reason why he signed this film. “To be honest, only scripts like these will give you a lot of scope to act. I have ample scope to showcase various emotions and I felt this would be the right platform to display my talent. Amritha and I rehearsed for a couple of days before we went for the actual shoot,” he says, adding, “The film’s shoot is almost over. We have about five more days left to complete the shooting and a travel song needs to be picturised. Since there is a Covid-19 threat, we are yet to plan the schedule.”So, what is it like to be back on a film’s set? “As always I am very happy. I feel like a student writing the public exam. But it was fun.” Yuva of Teddy and Natpuna Ennanu Theriyuma is cranking the camera, while newbie Britto is the music composer.

Title: Ananth’s slice-of-life film is an ode to ARR
Content: Actor Ananth , who wowed the audience with his performance as Hiphop Adhi’s brother in Meesaya Murukku, has taken on a new role — that of a director. The yet-to-be-titled film will also feature him in the lead, along with Kumaravel, Diyana Vaishalini, Leila, Ananth, Mirchi Vijay , Pooranesh, Wilspat, Irfan, Sabarish, RJ Aanandhi, Monica, Bhavani Sree, KPY Bala, Guhan, Fenny Oliver, TSR, Vinoth, Poovendhan, and Sai Venkatesh. The team recently launched the movie in the presence of Hiphop Tamizha and Dilli Babu.Ask him why he decided to turn director and Ananth says, “I have been a part of Naalaya Iyakunar and also directed Maanavan, a Tamizhanda movement initiative, which was conceptualised by Hiphop Tamizha. So, I have always wanted to venture out as a filmmaker, too.”Talking about his debut venture, he says, “This one is a slice-of-life film based on friendship. It tracks the journey of a bunch of people from 1992-2020. Youngsters will be able to relate to the story. If there are 50 scenes in the film, audiences will be able to see themselves in at least 30 of them. This film is packed with several emotions, talks about family bonding, friendship and love.”The interesting bit, he says, is that the film will be an ode to AR Rahman . “Just like how 96 was an ode to Ilaiyaraaja sir, this film will be a tribute to Rahman sir. In fact, the title that we have chosen — which will be announced soon — is a line from his famous Mustafa Mustafa,” says Ananth, “There will also be a lot of Chennai elements, Superstar and CSK.” The music will be composed by AH Kaashif, ARR’s nephew. “We’ve started shooting; apart from Chennai and Thiruttani, we’ll also head abroad for some portions,” informs Ananth.

Title: Salaga: Vijay to serenade Sanjana with a love song
Content: Singer-composer Naveen Sajju has a long association with Kannada actor Duniya Vijay . In fact, Naveen’s debut as composer was with the Vijay film, Kanaka, an opportunity given to him by the actor. And now, Naveen is working on Vijay’s directorial debut, Salaga, along with music man MR Charan Raj.” I am composing two of the four songs of the film, the first one being Sanjana I Love You , which will be released today. Vijay has always been closely involved with the creative aspects of his films and, back in the day, when I began singing for his movies, not only did we strike a rapport, but we also understood each other’s taste in music. When he asked me to compose a couple of songs for his directorial debut, I knew I had to give him my best. In a way, our personal bond was helpful, as I know what exactly he expects of me. Although Salaga is an underworld tale, it has a love story at its crux, and the song, Sanjana I Love You, written by lyricist-director Chethan Kumar , beautifully captures that emotion. Vijay wanted the song to reflect the fact that the protagonist is in love, while also having a fun element to it in a modern-day trendy tune. I composed it accordingly and have sung it as well. The promo of the song that we released online has been well received, so I am quite excited about the entire song coming out today, which has been picturised on Vijay and Sanjana Anand,” Naveen signs off.

Title: Madhushree plays an ace swimmer in Rathan’s Lock
Content: Sports-based films in Kollywood are aplenty. But there are not many that focus on the life of a swimmer. “That’s why I chose to make a film on a champion swimmer whose aim is to represent the country on an international forum. But this will not just be a sports entertainer — it’s a crime thriller that will revolve around a swimming champ,” begins Rathan Linga, who has completed 80 per cent of his film, Lock Ask him about the significance of the title and the director, who last helmed the critically acclaimed Attu, says, “The story is set in the backdrop of Muttukadu, where a family of three resides. While the parents are both doctors, their 18-year-old daughter is a state-level swimming champion. The day before she has to leave for a national meet, winning which could help her represent India internationally, she encounters a gang of psycho killers. How she, her parents and the killers get locked in a house and what would their fate be are what the film is about.”So, is the story a figment of his imagination or inspired by real events? “Several years ago, news of serial killing in the state made headlines. According to reports, these killers moved among public and murdered people when they felt like. Just like that! There was no planning involved. It affected me and that’s why I wrote this script,” he says, “The story happens in a span of three-four days and we are shooting in places like Pazhaverkadu and Thiruvallur now.”Rathan tells us that the film will be character-driven. “Madhushree, who has done significant roles in films like Gangs of Madras, Nadodigal 2 and Seeru, is playing the lead. She is also a swimmer and looks convincing as a schoolgirl who’s caught in a life-threatening situation. Srinivasa Varadhan and dance master Barathi are playing the role of the parents. Telugu actor Sudhir Reddy (of The End fame) and Harini play a director and his friend, who’s an aspiring actress, respectively. Both of them have integral roles to play,” he says, and adds, “KT Vimal is handling the cinematography while LVK Das is taking care of editing. We’ve roped in Nathan Lee as the stunt master. Vikram Selva, who has done films in Kannada and has also worked as a keyboard player for composers like Imman, Harris Jayaraj and Anirudh, has been roped in as the music director.”

Title: Mreenal Deshraj: The demands of the industry make me feel that I am living on the edge
Content: Mreenal Deshraj, who has been a part of many TV shows, including 'Naagin' and 'Ishqbaaz', says that being a television actor is not easy. Lack of quality work, she says, is very frustrating.“Whenever a show gets over, an actor goes through a lull. It is difficult to be mentally strong during this period. It has been almost eight months since I have been out of work. I am meeting people and discussions are on, but there is nothing concrete,” she says.Quality work apart, it’s also the long commute and low pay packets that add to actors’ woes. She says, “Most of the sets are located in Naigaon and the journey is long and tiring. Budget is another constraint. Even after being a senior actor, makers don’t offer us a decent pay packet . They want us to reduce our price to half of what we were earning earlier, because of the current financial crunch.”That’s not all. Mreenal says that the pressure to look good 24/7 is affecting her mental health. She says, “The makers expect us to look pretty and keep fit, work for 12 hours every day and also put in extra hours. There is a cost involved in keeping fit and looking good. I barely get any time for myself because post shoot, all my time goes in keeping myself fit. Whether you are working in a show or not, you have to look good at all times. The demands of the industry make me feel that I am living on the edge.”

Title: Yes Bank case: ED gets 5 days more to quiz Kapoor on 78 family firms
Content:
Yes Bank founder Rana Kapoor being taken to court for a hearing in connection with money laundering charges, i... Read More

MUMBAI: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday told the special Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court that Yes Bank co-promoter Rana Kapoor and his family members own 78 companies, with him managing their affairs. Seeking an extension of Kapoor's custody, the ED said it needed to ascertain the siphoning of funds from the bank into these companies.

ED's special counsel Sunil Gonsalves submitted that during Kapoor's tenure in the bank, amounts totalling over Rs 30,000 crore were disbursed as loans to several companies, which eventually turned to bad debt. "(Of these loans) more than Rs 20,000 crore sanctioned during Kapoor's tenure have turned into non-performing assets. The sanctioning of the loans from the point of view of irregularity, quid pro quo, and diversion is being investigated," ED told the court.

After both sides made submissions, special judge Prashant R Rajvaidya remanded 62-year-old Kapoor in ED's custody until March 16. Kapoor was arrested early on Sunday morning and this was his second remand hearing. ED commenced arguments seeking custody extension for seven days. Gonsalves told the court ED needed to confront Kapoor with voluminous documents and several key witnesses, including the bank's management whose statements were yet to be recorded.

The remand plea was strongly opposed by Kapoor's advocate, Satish Maneshinde, who repeatedly told the court he was being made a scapegoat since the finance minister had made a statement about hauling up the person responsible for the bank's downfall. The defence also cited numerous awards won by Kapoor over the years. "When he left the bank, its market cap was around Rs 93,000 crore; after that the value under a new management came down to Rs 5,000 core. The finance minister made a statement that somebody responsible for this should be hauled up. When (Kapoor) left the bank, NPAs were 1%, not the Rs 20,000 crore they are saying now. Therefore, he cannot be held responsible," Maneshinde submitted.

He said Kapoor had filed statements of all 78 companies in his own or his wife and children's control. "None of the auditors has taken an exception to any of the investments or expenses incurred by Kapoor," the defence said. It said ED went to Kapoor's house on March 6 on bogus grounds to investigate if the bank's transactions related to a separate criminal case against DHFL's alleged involvement in the purchase of (deceased) drug smuggler Iqbal Mirchi's properties in 2010. The defence said that after ED realised it had bungled, as an afterthought it registered an offence relating to the purchase of debentures worth Rs 3,700 crore in DHFL.

The defence also said that for four months Kapoor was in London with his family and repaying debts. "He has sold his assets and settled debts worth more than Rs 1,900 crore. He came back to India because there were negotiations between him and RBI and the top hierarchy of the finance ministerial department to take over the bank again because it was going down," the defence submitted. Maneshinde said that a week prior to this incident, Kapoor sat with several senior government and RBI officials.

The defence also denied that the Rs 600 crore loan given by DHFL to Kapoor's daughters' company DOIT Urban Ventures was a kickback. He said that Rs 130 crore in interest has been paid and the loan is being settled. "No bribe taker will take the amount in cheque and no fool will return the amount or interest," the defence said. Denying that the security given against the loan was meagre and bogus, the defence said that assets of each of Kapoor's daughters was around Rs 1,700 crore. It said that they had sufficient assets to repay double the loan. The defence also denied that the loan taken was not utilised for business or the company was a dummy or the money was siphoned off for other purposes.

Maneshinde said that about Rs 175 crore was invested in an international design school and investments were also made in hospitality, eco-tourism, healthcare and wellness ventures and all companies were audited.

Title: Churchill Bros sack coach with five games remaining in I-League
Content:
Panaji: Churchill Brothers FC have parted ways with coach Bernardo Tavares and have handed charge to Mateus Costa for the rest of the team’s campaign in the I-League .

The club’s decision was communicated to the Portuguese coach a day after the loss against Gokulam Kerala FC as the visitors struck in the 90th minute to win 2-1 at the Nehru Stadium in Fatorda on Sunday.

Chasing the runnersup spot, particularly after Mohun Bagan had opened a huge gap – they eventually won the title on Tuesday – the loss against Gokulam Kerala hurt Churchill, and club patron Churchill Alemao decided to pull the trigger.

Tavares did not show up for training for the last two days and instead Mateus, who has coached Sporting Clube de Goa in the past, has been calling the shots.

“We decided it was time to bring in a new coach,” Alemao confirmed to TOI on Wednesday.

The loss against Gokulam Kerala left Churchill in eighth spot. As of now, they seem closer to the relegation zone with just three teams below them. But the teams are so close to each other that just three points separate them and second-placed East Bengal and Punjab FC, both of whom have played an extra game.

Churchill now have 20 points from 15 matches, the same as Gokulam Kerala, TRAU and Real Kashmir FC, while they are tied on points with defending champions Chennai City FC. Should they win their game against Real Kashmir next week, they will move up to third on the table.

It is not a surprise that Churchill have decided to shake things up, even though there are just five games left to be played. The runners-up spot in the I-League could have a lot of significance. Should ATK win the Indian Super League (ISL) final against Chennaiyin FC on Saturday, I-League runners-up will qualify for the AFC Cup group stage, thanks to ATK’s tie-up with Bagan from next season.

Churchill started with three consecutive wins, including a 4-2 demolition of Bagan in Kolkata, but since then lost their way. The former champions lost many games at home, including against considerably weaker opposition, with Tavares frustrated at the lack of sharpness upfront.

“It’s very difficult to be in this situation because we are working in a good direction. In football , the most difficult thing is to create opportunities, and when chances are created, there will be a goal. We’ve had bad luck too. But history won’t record the chances we created. After two three days, only the result is remembered. Moral victories don’t give you any points

“We are training everyday on finalisation. We are training to finish crosses, making overlaps and play small-sided games too. We have many exercises to help the team improve in these kind of situations. There is an element of luck too, but we cannot say that we have been unlucky all the time. There has to be more focus and attention upfront when shooting at goal,” Bernard had said in one of his pre-match press conferences, referring to the 20-odd chances they create in every game.

Churchill’s remaining five games are all away as they travel from Kashmir to Tamil Nadu.

REMAINING GAMES

March 18: Real Kashmir vs Churchill

March 22: Punjab FC vs Churchill

March 29: Chennai City vs Churchill

April 3: Indian Arrows vs Churchill

April 12: Neroca vs Churchill

Title: #CoronaScare grips NCR: Commuters unwilling to share cabs with strangers
Content: With over 60 confirmed coronavirus cases in India, the fear of catching the virus from strangers has only gone up. The COVID-19 outbreak has affected not only the way we greet each other but also the way we travel. People who used to prefer travelling in app-based shared cabs, which are far more economical, are not so keen on sharing space now – they would rather take personal cabs, instead of travelling with strangers. The idea is to reduce personal contact with strangers as much as possible.Ishita Gupta, a resident of Dwarka who works in Gurgaon, shares, “Last week, the person sitting next to me couldn’t stop sneezing. We were three people sitting in the backseat and were really close to each other. Generally, it wouldn’t have bothered me as much as it did now, with the fear of the disease spreading. I have now started booking personal cabs.” The personal cabs may be a on the pricier side but people are ready to shell out extra if it means that they can avoid sitting next to strangers. “I would usually take shared cabs as it becomes lighter on the pocket. However, with the panic around coronavirus, I have now started booking personal cabs for myself since the past one week,” says Shikha Joshi, a resident of Vaishali, who works in Noida. She adds, “They may cost Rs60-80 higher, as compared to shared cabs, but at least, the probability of me catching the virus from co-passenger reduces.” However, when it comes to carpooling with other residents of one’s society or neighbours, people are less sceptical. “We all know the people who travel with us, so we have not yet stopped the carpooling group. In case someone turns up sick, we would just refuse to take them on,” says Shivang Chauhan, a resident of Greater Noida West, who uses a carpooling group of his society to commute to his office.It’s not just the commuters who are taking precautions. Cab drivers, too, are making sure they sanitise their car after every ride and are preferring personal bookings. “I have switched from driving for cab-pool to driving for personal bookings. Though I cannot ask a sick person to get out of the car in either of the cases, but at least, the chances of driving with a person who’s unwell get somewhat reduced ,” says Satendra Yadav, who drives app-based cabs. Another driver, Shahid, shares, “We ferry over 50 people in a day in our cabs and we cannot choose who we allow in the cab. So we need to take all the precautions. Every time, after I drop someone, I clean the doors, handles and spray sanitiser on the seat.”

Title: Homi Adajania and Dinesh Vijan talk about Angrezi Medium
Content: I remember, I narrated the story of Being Cyrus to Dinesh, and he asked me how many days I would take to make the film. I had no clue, as I had never made a film before. I told him that I'd finish it in 30 days. He said that if I took more than 30 days, I would have to pay from my own pocket. By the end of that day, I was a little worried. I asked him, ‘What if it starts raining and that disrupts the shoot?’ It was like dumb and dumber (laughs!).It was a level playing field. He didn’t know how to direct, and I didn’t know how to produce. We were trying our best to keep that fact hidden from the other (laughs!). The thing is that Homi and I learnt the business together and we have had an interesting journey.The only thing common between us was that we wanted to tell stories -- that was our passion. After the first film, I became a scuba diving instructor. One day I got a call from Dinesh for Cocktail. A romantic comedy was virgin territory for me. He approached me so that I could bring my own palette to the genre. Dinesh always believed in my potential, while I have been blind towards it. One thing that has worked for us is that we have never lie to each other. Even when I agreed to do Cocktail, I told him that I still don’t believe in the story, and I will give the subject my own twist. He said that’s exactly what he wanted me to do.Even films likeorthat I have backed have been as reckless as Cocktail. If I like a story, I want to tell it, and one does everything to make it happen. One week before a film’s release, I know where we stand. My average products have never worked. Initially, I would wish that I could get away with it, but that has never happened. If it is a good film, and it doesn’t work for some reason, then I am okay with it. But, if it is a bad film, then it is not forgivable.In the last 15 years, filmmakers have destroyed the business because we wanted to make money beforehand and we didn’t want anyone else to make money. We also wanted to ensure that if our film failed, we would not be at risk. That model changed for us with Stree (2018). Since then, we have made money and at the same time, done better films. Nobody wanted to put their money on Stree. I had no option but to back it myself. It was all or nothing, and it could have shut us down. I will tell you about my production house’s formula. We believe that if it doesn’t fire, nobody loses money and only if it fires, we make money. A film has to run in theatres. If that doesn’t happen, it is sad as a lot of work goes into it. My upcoming release, Angrezi Medium is an entertaining film. I have no problem if you love it or hate it. But, being indifferent towards a film is scary!Well, the experience changed everyone. It made me change the way I make my films. After all, you are making a film and not curing a disease. Don’t take it so seriously! The entire experience of shooting Angrezi Medium will always be a wonderful memory. Making this film has made me a better person. In fact, it has touched everyone in one way or another. It the kind of experience, which uplifts your spirit and makes you understand what resilience is. We knew all about the risks. We went into it with our eyes open. There was no question of tiptoeing around Irrfan. The fact is that we addressed the elephant in the room. He had cancer and was undergoing treatment. And we all were living life the way that way one is supposed to. Nothing has to stop at any point in your life. That’s the spirit with which we kept going. Irrfan, too, soldiered on with passion and wasn’t stressed about it. It was inspiring seeing him do what he was doing.When the unit was shooting in London, I was supposed to be on set only for five days, but Irrfan asked me to stay back. He told me he feels positive when I am around. So, I stayed back for him. There was never a gloomy moment on the set of the film.A lot of actresses were keen to play this role as the first one (English Medium, 2017) did so well. So, whichever manager approached us with their client's name, I showed them Radhika's audition video. And after that they agreed that Radhika was apt for the role.Dinesh showed me her audition for Pataakha (2018). I remember she had invited me to watch the film, but unfortunately, I wasn't in town. Later, she messaged me and asked if she could audition for this role. I turned down her request and told her that we wanted a younger actress to play the part of the 18-year-old girl. Regardless of that, she sent her audition video. I was just blown away seeing her performance.Yes, Angrezi Medium is very much out of my comfort zone.I feel that if you have something on paper, and a good director on board, then language can never be a barrier. I felt Homi would be perfect to direct this film because he is an amazing father. He has two boys, and I have seen their equation. He also has maximum respect for writing and writers.The film is about a parent and a child. Personally, as a father, I really get scared of some situations. You hold the hands of your little ones; show them the way, and then one day you let them go. You do that with a lot of pride and as much pain and a lot of hope in your heart that one day, when you need them, they will come back to you. This is the sur of this film. The writer got it, Irrfan got it, and then, we all were on the same page.He is a very good producer, let him produce (laughs!).We do a lot of stuff for validation. As you grow older, you realise this. I though t I was enamoured by direction. When I did it, I realised I genuinely loved producing. Ten years later, I feel the urge to direct, then I’ll think about it at that time. Right now, producing is working well for me. Now that I have been through the process of direction, it helps me better my production skills, too. I believe we have a lot of directors, but only a few producers who can add value to a director's vision. Though your failure teaches you much more than your victory, life is too short to make all your mistakes. So, you learn from other’s mistakes. Today, all filmmakers get along with each other and use each other’s creativity. It helps and it also gives a good vibe.Of course! After all, if films do well, then it is more conducive and beneficial for us as an industry. For some strange reason, earlier, we would feel that people didn't want someone else to do well within the industry. But that has changed now.When I met a well-known Hollywood film producer he said, “You know why Hollywood works? Because the top five people (of the industry) get along really well.” We need to take from each other if we want to grow the business.The film industry can be wiped out if we don’t stick together and grow the business.

Title: After Kiki, Drake’s #fliptheswitch challenge goes viral
Content: Drake’s done it again! After creating a tweetstorm and starting an Instafire with his Kiki song, he’s got folks grooving to his latest. The lyrics of the song Nonstop — ‘I just flip the switch’ — has kick-started a #Fliptheswitch challenge, where people do everything, from dancing to exchanging clothes and making faces, right at the flip of a switch. It began over a week ago and has gone viral , sweeping social media with memes, and attracting a host of famous names to try it.The #fliptheswitch challenge is a 16-second video in which two people stand in front of a mirror and dance. When the lyrics (‘Look, I just flipped the switch (flipped, flipped), I don’t know nobody else that’s doin’ this’) start, the light goes off and they swap their positions and outfits.A number of celebs have embarked on this. Alex Rodriguez aka A-Rod and Jennifer Lopez , for one. They stood in front of a mirror while the singer moved her hips to Nonstop. They then ‘flip the switch’, the lights go off, and the couple switched clothes. JLo is then seen holding the phone, wearing A-Rod’s suit and sunglasses, while the former baseball star rocked Lopez’s white fitting dress and gold hoops.A-Rod posted a video of it on Instagram and it has garnered millions of views! Singer Camila Cabello and actress Emily Ratajkowski have also tried it and US senator Elizabeth Warren has joined in on the fun, too. What’s more, several comedians and others have added a creative twist to the challenge by involving their baby, grandparent or even their pet to create their version of it.The ‘Flip The Switch’ challenge, that’s been creating a huge buzz over the last few weeks, sees people dancing, swapping clothes and having fun moving to the beat of Drake ’s single, Nonstop. The challenge takes place at the beginning of the rapper’s song.

Title: Shailendra Singh: To lead India's Over 50 World Cup cricket team is exciting
Content: After producing films, Shailendra Singh is now on a new field, and yes, it’s a totally different ball game, literally. He is the captain of India’s over-50 cricket team.Before leaving for Cape Town for the game, which is being held this month, he had a brief chat with BT.“To lead India in the game of cricket, and that too, at the age of 53, is exciting,” said Shailendra, who’s heading the 16-member Indian team at the world cup, held from March 11 to March 24.“There is no nervousness or pressure, as I see this as an opportunity to make India proud in a game that is considered religion here,” he shared. When asked about the challenges, he replied, “It will be challenging to maintain post-game fitness and recoup, as we have matches every alternate day.”However, the team is well prepared, as they began the prep in November, last year. “We have been working out, discussing post-50 fitness (since all players are above 50 years old), and following a strict diet. We have also practised rigorously.”Shailendra, who considers Kapil Dev and MS Dhoni his cricketing idols, has previously captained the Bombay Gymkhana team and also played county cricket in the UK. “As a captain, I will bring an unlimited amount of passion and unconditional commitment on ground. I will use my experience to put up a tough fight for the opposition,” he said.The Indian team primarily consists of Ranji Trophy players, club players and those who play on the international circuit. Other countries participating in the game include Australia, Canada, New Zealand, England, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.

Title: Sara disagrees with Saif’s views on modern work culture
Content: Parent-child arguments are common in every family and our stars are no different. In a recent interview with BT, Sara Ali Khan had said that she enjoys having healthy arguments with her father, Saif Ali Khan . And it looks like Sara has agreed to disagree with her dad once again.In an earlier chat with us, Saif had pointed out the changes in the work culture between actors of his generation and newcomers. He had said, “I see so much of this management or mismanagement happening today, where people are trying to create a personality for actors by making them do this, go there and say that. It is too choreographed. I think you have to be yourself.”When we asked Sara to react to her father’s statement, she disagreed, saying, “I think to each his own. I cannot say that everybody should be themselves, maybe some people are actually very shady. Maybe they need to be managed and need to have a choreographed personality that works for them. I, as a person, am not like that. At the end of it, it’s a job, people make income out of managing your public image, you don’t want to take that away. The more people you feed, the better it is.”So, whose side are you on?

Title: Ankit Siwach to play a villain in ‘Beyhadh 2’
Content: Ankit Siwach, who was last seen in ‘Manmohini’, has been signed on to play the new villain in ‘ Beyhadh 2 ’. The actor tells us, “I am getting to play an anti-hero for the first time. I won’t call him the villain in Maya’s ( Jennifer Winget ) life; it’s just that they had a past, which didn’t turn out to be a fairy tale. It would be great to share screen space with Jennifer.”This is his first show post marriage (Ankit tied the knot with Nupur Bhatia on February 4) and he is excited about getting back to work. The actor says, “This is also my third show with producer Prateek Sharma, which makes this outing even more special. ‘Beyhadh 2’ is a finite series and all characters are written well in advance and all of them have a specified beginning and ending revolving around Maya’s love life.”Ask him if it would be challenging for him to join the show midway and he replies, “Jennifer, Shivin Narang and Ashish Chowdhry have already established themselves. My character will add to the drama and make it spicier.”The actor says that though the ratings govern his decision when it comes to taking up a show, he didn’t think twice before signing ‘Beyhadh 2’. He says, “TRPs do influence one’s decision, but what matters most is the storyline and the impact of the character you are playing. Everything else can be taken care of,” he signs off.

Title: Allies leave Congress to fend for itself, scuttle plans to boost RS numbers
Content:
(File photo)

NEW DELHI: Congress's entreaties to three allies for Rajya Sabha berths in their bastions have come unstuck, dealing a blow to the party's hopes of using the coming elections to boost its upper House tally beyond its numbers. The principal opposition party had urged DMK in Tamil Nadu, JMM in Jharkhand and RJD in Bihar for support so that it could field candidates despite lacking the numbers. While DMK would have to concede a seat that it can win on its own, JMM and RJD have the numbers to help a Congress nominee win.

However, all three parties have turned down the requests and Congress would now have to contend with what it can win on its own across state assemblies. A calculation suggests that Congress can win eight seats if it can keep its flock together. The loss of over 20 MLAs, and possibly the state government, in Madhya Pradesh can cost the party the second seat that it was in a position to win in Bhopal.

The party will also have to be careful in Haryana where it has a very thin buffer to win a seat. Given that it requires numbers in the upper House to boost its diminishing political muscle, the refusal of alliance partners to heed its requests suggests that successive Lok Sabha debacles have seriously affected Congress' standing in the anti-BJP axis.

The party commanded a strong position vis-a-vis allies during the UPA decade. But even after losing power in 2014, it continued to have its way with partners in political negotiations. Now, the failure to eke out a single RS seat despite multiple requests marks a serious setback for the principal opposition party.

The most interesting bit happened in Bihar where Congress felt that ally RJD could be persuaded to cede a seat. Given that RJD's core ambitions revolve around the coming assembly elections in October, it was felt that Lalu Prasad's party would want to keep allies in good humour. But when private negotiations did not help, Congress state in-charge Shaktisinh Gohil wrote a letter to RJD "to keep its commitment", triggering a media spectacle. However, RJD shot back with a public refusal.

The same has been the response of DMK. Given that it has always given primacy to state politics, the Dravidian outfit was expected to be more indulgent towards allies after its failure to dislodge AIADMK in the last polls. JMM recently formed the government with the support of Congress, which won its largest tally in many years.

Content: After the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Forensic Medical Board ruled out the murder angle in Sushant Singh Rajput’s death report, an audio tape of Dr Sudhir Gupta has been leaked wherein he reportedly claims that the late actor was ‘murdered’. When ETimes reached out to Sushant Singh Rajput’s family lawyer Vikas Singh for his reaction on the same, he stated, “To be honest, I tweeted my stand yesterday but I would like to speak to him before I take a final call. He is not answering my phone, what if he changes his stand, one doesn’t know. I will wait till I can talk to him.”

Title: Amit Shah: Action against Delhi riots accused will serve as example
Content:
Union home minister Amit Shah speaks in Lok Sabha (ANI)

NEW DELHI: Home minister Amit Shah on Wednesday vowed to ensure punishment for those responsible for the Delhi riots irrespective of their religion, caste and political affiliation, asserting that action against the culprits would go down as an example for future rioters across the country.

“I convey my condolences to all those who have lost their family members. I promise that none of the guilty will be spared no matter which religion, caste or political party they belong to. Delhi Police will act with such firmness that these riots will become a case study of the consequences that should visit those engage in riots,” Shah told Lok Sabha after an over five-hour debate on communal violence in the Capital.

Home minister Amit Shah said the government wants to set up a claims commission to recover damages from rioters, and the Delhi high court has already been approached for the purpose.

“About 700 FIRs have been filed, 152 weapons used in violence seized and 49 cases lodged under the Arms Act. Also, 2,647 people have been detained or arrested so far,” Shah said.

Congress walked out of the House during the reply, provoking a sharp response from the usually quiet highways minister Nitin Gadkari.

Responding to attacks from Congress which demanded his resignation and others in the opposition, Shah strongly rebutted the charges of failure and police inaction, saying the communal violence that claimed 53 lives was a pre-planned, well-organised conspiracy executed with hawala funds. “The spread of riots on such a big scale in such a short time is not possible without a conspiracy. We have registered a case of conspiracy to probe this angle. Three people have been arrested for financing the violence in northeast Delhi,” he said.

A combative Shah marshalled details to refute that Delhi police, which works under the home ministry, had failed, saying that riots had been controlled within 36 hours and were not allowed to spread beyond 12 police stations. “The first complaint of riot was reported at 2 pm on February 24. It goes to the credit of the force that not a single incident of rioting took place after 11 pm on February 25,” he said.

Shah said it was an achievement considering that northeast district had the highest population density in the country, was marked by a maze of narrow lanes and had a historically high crime rate. “It borders UP from where 300 criminals were brought in as part of a sinister conspiracy to organise violence during the visit of US President Donald Trump,” he added.

The minister focused on the role of social media in what has been dubbed the first “digitised riots”. “More than 60 social media accounts were created specifically to incite communal violence between February 22 and 26,” he added.

Shah said many of the social media accounts were since shut but police were looking for those responsible. “If they feel that they will get away, they are mistaken, law will take its course,” he said, adding that 25 cases under the IT Act had been registered.

He responded to the charge that the Union government failure to take action against BJP members who made “provocative speeches” by referring to speeches of AIMIM’s Waris Pathan and others to say that inflammatory comments defined anti-CAA protests. He also mentioned the “aar-paar ki ladai” comment Sonia Gandhi had made at Ramlila Maidan, although he did not name the Congress chief. The minister stressed that riots were not a spontaneous outbreak.

Responding to the allegation that the Centre delayed debate in Parliament, he said the government wanted the riots to be discussed after Holi to avoid communal flare-up during festival time. “There has been a history of communal clashes during Holi. It seems others had other priorities,” he said.

He refused the demand for a community-wise break-up of fatalities and said, “I won’t give figures in ‘Hindu-Muslim’ as has been demanded by some members. 53 Indians have died, 526 Indians have been injured. Shops of 371 Indians were set ablaze and houses of 142 Indians were burned.”

Shah also denied that he was missing in action. “I was in Ahmedabad on February 24 because the public reception for the visiting US President had been organised in my constituency. I came back the same evening and stayed away from Trump’s reception at Rashtrapati Bhavan, and the banquet organised for him to concentrate on the deployment of security forces,” he said.

In Video: Total of 2,647 people have been detained or arrested for violence in Delhi, says Amit Shah

Title: UP takes battle over 'recovery' hoardings to SC
Content:
LUCKNOW: The UP government on Wednesday moved the Supreme Court against an Allahabad high court order directing it to take down the ‘name and shame’ hoardings installed across Lucknow city against 57 persons accused of “vandalising public properties” during anti-CAA protests on December 19, 2019. The appeal would be taken up on Thursday by a vacation bench of Justice UU Lalit and Aniruddha Bose.

Confirming this, UP advocate general Raghevendra Singh told TOI that the government challenged the HC order though a special leave petition in the SC. “We will take up the same points in the SC that we took up before the HC. There is one additional point about the right to privacy under Article 21. Our contention is that the details of all these persons were already in public domain through print and electronic media and, therefore, there is no question of breach of privacy,” he said.

Meanwhile, three of those whose photographs are on the hoardings — retired IPS officer and activist SR Darapuri, Congress member Sadaf Jafar and theatre personality Deepak Kabir — will file a caveat on Thursday against the government’s plea. “The caveat would ensure that before the court delivers any order, it would have to hear us out,” Darapuri said.

He told TOI that they learnt about the SC petition very late on Wednesday. Hence, their lawyers could not reach the court in time.

Sources in UP home department added that till the hearing in the apex court, no action was likely to be initiated by the government to remove the hoardings. The court and government offices were closed for Holi on Tuesday and as soon as they reopened a day later, the government submitted its plea in the SC, challenging the high court order calling the Lucknow administration’s move an “unwarranted interference in the privacy of people”.

On Saturday, the high court had taken suo motu cognizance of hoardings put up across Lucknow last week, carrying addresses and photographs of 57 persons who were accused of damaging properties in the violence during anti-CAA protests on December 19, 2019. The government had already issued recovery notices against these persons.

Delivering its order on Monday, the high court directed the government to immediately remove the hoardings and file a status report by March 16.

Title: SBI FD rates below 6%, lowest since ’04
Content: MUMBAI: State Bank of India has cut deposit rates to its lowest level since 2004 and has done away with the minimum balance requirement for all its 44.5 crore savings accounts. The bank also trimmed interest rates on savings deposits by 25 basis points and cut the interest rate on loans by 10 bps (100 bps = 1 percentage point).Following the reduction in fixed deposit rates, the highest return offered by SBI is 5.9% on deposits above a year. The last time FD rates were below 6% was in August 2004. The bank's reduction in its marginal cost of lending rate (MCLR) by 10 basis points will bring down home loan rates for those who borrowed before October 2019.SBI had reintroduced the minimum balance charges in April 2017 after five years of waiving it. The penalty for not maintaining minimum balance was the cause of much heartburn as the fines were levied on those who did not have enough money. In FY18 the bank collected Rs 2,400 crore by way of these charges which caused an uproar as those who were penalised included poor people who had opened accounts after demonetisation. Thereafter SBI revised the charges to Rs 5 to Rs 15 + taxes on non-maintenance of average monthly balances."We have been earning Rs 50-60 crore a month on these charges," said Praveen Kumar Gupta, MD, State Bank of India.He said that given the dissatisfaction over the charges the bank decided to waive them. The bank has also waived the charges for SMS alerts to customers. "The people who were being hit by these charges were the ones that needed to be financially included. We were not charging this in the past and we felt that these charges were something we could live without," said Gupta.On the reduction of the interest rates on savings account above Rs 1 lakh from 3.25% to 3%, Gupta said that a uniform 3% rate makes life easier for everyone.Meanwhile, the reduction in the MCLR is the 10th consecutive cut in MCLR in FY 2019-20 and applies to the benchmark rate across all tenures. The bank's one-year MCLR, against which home loans before October 2019 were pegged stands revised to be 7.75% from March 10, 2020. Consequently, EMIs on eligible home loan accounts (linked to MCLR) will get cheaper by around Rs 7 per 1 lakh on a 30-year loan. EMIs on car loans will also be reduced by Rs 5 per 1 lakh on a 7-year loan.The cut in deposit rates comes on the back of a liquidity surge in the money markets. The crash in crude oil prices and an economic slowdown triggered by the coronavirus has raised hopes of RBI easing monetary policy. As a result, the yield on the benchmark 10-year debt slid as much as 13 basis points to 6.05% on Monday, a level last seen in 2009. SBI has brought its retail term deposit interest rates by 10 bps for '1 year & above' tenor and 50 bps for deposits up to '45 days'. Bulk term deposit interest rates are reduced by 15 bps for deposits in '180 days & above' tenors.

Title: 38,000 sq km of Ladakh’s area under China control: Govt in Parl
Content:
(Representative image)

NEW DELHI: The government reiterated in Parliament that 38,000 sq km of Indian territory was under China’s occupation in the Union Territory of Ladakh and that Arunachal Pradesh and the entire UTs of J&K and Ladakh would remain an integral part of India.

Responding to a written question in Lok Sabha, the government also called upon Pakistan to desist from making attempts to bring any “material change’’ in J&K and Ladakh

“China disputes the international boundary between India and China. In the eastern sector, China claims approximately 90,000 sq km of Indian territory in the state of Arunachal Pradesh. Indian territory under the occupation of China in the Union Territory of Ladakh is approximately 38,000 sq km,’’ junior foreign minister V Muraleedharan said.

He added that under the so-called ‘Boundary Agreement’ signed between China and Pakistan on March 2, 1963, Pakistan illegally ceded 5,180 sq km of Indian territory in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir to China.

“India’s consistent and principled position is that Arunachal Pradesh and the entire Union Territories of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh have been, are and shall be an integral part of India. This fact has been clearly conveyed to the Chinese side on several occasions," the minister said.

Replying to a separate query, Muraleedharan said the government was monitoring all developments taking place in Indian territories, including in territories under Pakistan’s illegal and forcible occupation.

“We have consistently called upon Pakistan to immediately vacate all areas under its illegal and forcible occupation, and to put an end to human rights violations and desist from continued attempts to bring material change in these territories,’’ he said.

The minister was replying to a query seeking to know what the government was doing to realise the 1994 Parliament resolution on PoK.

“Government’s consistent and principled position, as also enunciated in the Parliament resolution adopted unanimously by both Houses on February 22, 1994, is that the entire Union Territories of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh have been, are and shall be an integral part of India,’’ Muraleedharan said.

Title: Jyotiraditya Scindia joins BJP, say India's future safe in Modi's hands
Content: NEW DELHI: Jyotiraditya Scindia formally joined BJP on Wednesday, welcomed by party president Jagat Prakash Nadda, even as his exit forced Congress to scramble to try and convince rebel MLAs, seen to be loyal to Scindia, to return and secure the Kamal Nath government.The estranged Congress functionary was accorded a high-profile reception with Nadda and other seniors on the dais as Scindia said, "There is denial of reality in Congress, it has changed from what the party used to be." He added that Congress had lost the capacity to assess and analyse ground realities. "My aim has always been to serve people and politics is only a means to fulfil that," he added.The former central minister, who was named BJP's Rajya Sabha nominee from Madhya Pradesh soon after, thanked PM Narendra Modi and home minister Amit Shah for giving him a platform to serve people. Praising Modi, he said, "Nobody has leadership qualities like him. The way he ensures implementation of schemes in the country, we can say that the future of the country is in safe hands.""There are three reasons to it, first, rejecting the realities, second, living in their own falsely created realities and third, not giving proper leadership to party workers on the basis of abilities. This is the condition of the party at the national level," he said.As Scindia joined BJP, rebel Congress MLAs, camping in Bengaluru, reposed faith in him, making it clear that the saffron party is on the brink of making a serious attempt to form the government in MP.The announcement of a RS berth was significant, given that the uncertainty over his being named for a seat by Congress was the trigger that turned discontent into a rebellion and prompted Scindia to part ways with the party. The move sent shock waves through Congress as the MP duo of CM Nath and Digvijaya Singh - as also the party brass - did not expect Scindia to walk out, that too with a large number of MLAs.Nadda assured Jyotiraditya Scindia that he would be a mainstream leader, hinting at a position of responsibility, possibly a cabinet berth. Nadda also recalled contributions made by Scindia's grandmother Vijayaraje Scindia in founding saffron organisations from Jan Sangh to BJP and termed it a great moment for the entire organisation. "You will be one of our mainstream leaders in the party," Nadda said and assured that the party would provide him an opportunity to work with full freedom.Soon after joining, Scindia had a long meeting with Nadda at the BJP office and they are learnt to have discussed the situation in MP as resignation of 21 Congress MLAs are pending with the Speaker. Scindia said the present condition of Congress indicated that it was not what it used to be. "I can say with confidence that the aim of public service is not being fulfilled by that party (Congress). Besides this, the present condition of the party indicates that it is not what it used to be," he said and recalled several other reasons that led to his decision.Attacking the Kamal Nath government, Scindia said, "In MP, we dreamt of taking the state to new heights of development after forming government in 2018. But we failed. Kamal Nath's government failed to waive off loans of farmers even after 18 months. They have not provided any compensation for crop failures. There is no employment generation in the state and there is growing corruption."He added, "There have been two life-changing days for me for me, one was September 30, 2001, the day I lost my father, and the second is March 10, 2020, when I decided to choose a new path for my life. I would like to thank J P Naddaji, PM Narendra Modi, home minister Amit Shah that they invited me to their family and gave me a place in the party where I can contribute for the betterment of my state and country."

Title: Tiger Shroff and Shraddha Kapoor's 'Baaghi 3' is on a course to be hit; crosses Rs 80crore at the box office on the 6th day
Content: Tiger Shroff, Shraddha Kapoor and Riteish Deshmukh starrer 'Baaghi 3' has been the talk of the town since the announcement. The trailer and songs of the film received a lot of love from the audience. Also, Tiger and Shraddha's fans were happy to watch them together on screen once again! The lead stars left no stones unturned to promote the film on various platforms.The film which released last Friday is having a successful run at the box office. Now, according to BoxOfficeIndia's early estimate report, the film has collected around Rs 7.25 - 7.50 crore net on its sixth day (Wednesday) since the release. With this, the total collection of the film is Rs 82.25 - 82.50 crore nett. The report further states that the action-adventure will around Rs 87-88 crore in its first week. It also states that if the film shows a decent second Friday number, it will be the second hit of the year.Also, due to coronavirus threat, there are a lot of viewers who are hesitating to come out to watch the film. As a result of the awareness, the film has suffered in big cities!The plot of the film revolves around a fiercely protective Ronnie who goes up against a dreaded terrorist group in Syria to save his brother Vikram (Riteish Deshmukh) from their clutches.While talking about the action sequences in the film, Jr Shroff said, "About 90 per cent of the scenes include live-action. Also, we wanted to give viewers as real and powerful a visual as is possible, and hence [minimised] VFX work."Meanwhile, in the film, Tiger has reprised his character, Ronnie, of the previous installments. Helmed by Ahmed Khan , the film also stars Jaideep Ahlawat, Ankita Lokhande , Vijay Verma, Jackie Shroff and Ashutosh Rana in pivotal roles.Backed by Sajid Nadiadwala , the film has hit the theatres on March 06.

Title: ‘Keep viral infections at bay’
Content: PATNA: Amid the coronavirus (COVID-19) scare, even minor symptoms like running nose, watery eyes and throat pain, which are likely to occur due to viral infections, are compelling people to visit doctors at once.Health experts have, therefore, advised Patnaites not to panic and take precautions to keep viral infections at bay. “These days, I am treating at least 50 people suffering from cold, fever and cough on a daily basis. But they are not infected by COVID-19. In fact, we have had no cases of the virus in Bihar and I urge people to stay calm,” PMCH medicine department associate professor Dr R D Singh told TOI on Wednesday.He added, “Allergies and some viral infections occur due to seasonal change from February to April every year.”Another city-based physician, Dr Diwakar Tejaswi, claimed that many people were suffering from flu, which could lead to fever, body ache, nasal congestion, sore throat and cough. “Even the symptoms of influenza or allergy have terrified people,” he said.Talking about the symptomatic differences between flu and COVID-19, Dr Teashwi said, “In case of flu, there is no laboured breathing and the recovery period is around a week. The period of recovery in case of COVID-19 is long.”Apart from various viral infections, doctors pointed out that pollen grains in the atmosphere were causing allergies.“When allergens enter the lower respiratory tract, they may cause spasm and secretion in the respiratory tract. Narrowing of the tract may lead to breathlessness. Also, in case of allergies, there is no fever,” he added.

Title: Tej Pratap celebrates Holi in style of Lalu
Content:
PATNA: Former health minister Tej Pratap Yadav on Tuesday revived the memory of his father and incarcerated RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s famous Holi this time.

Face smeared in different colours and dholak in his lap, Tej could be heard singing Phagwa songs and humming ‘Baba Harihar Nath Baba Harihar Nath Sonepur me Holi Khele’ at his 2-M Strand Road Bungalow.

“My father used to sing this song (Baba Harihar Nath). I have to continue with those rituals,” said Tej, adding, “I am chota (younger) Lalu and whatever papa used to do I will do that. I am missing papa today and wish he will be among us very soon.”

Tej even took to posh city areas on bike. He then went to seek blessings of his mother and former chief minister Rabri Devi at her 10, Circular Road bungalow. Emotional Rabri could be seen blessing her son and his friends on the occasion.

It was in 2016 that the Lalu family had celebrated Holi at their official residence. In 2017, the family abstained from celebrating Holi because of death of 26 people in hailstorm in Bihar. From 2018 onwards, no Holi celebration had taken place at Rabri’s residence since Lalu had been jailed in fodder scam cases. In 2018, the death of Lalu’s elder sister Gangotri Devi was also a reason from avoiding any celebration that year.

Meanwhile, Tej flayed chief minister Nitish Kumar and ruling party leaders for not celebrating Holi. “Coronavirus has nothing to do with Holi celebration. They are doing politics,” he said.

No Holi celebration was held even at CM’s residence. Senior BJP leaders had also cancelled their Holi celebration this year as advised by the experts across the globe to avoid mass gathering taking into account the spread of coronavirus.

Title: 30 injured as under-construction iron bridge collapses in Mandvi
Content:
Surat: Tourists had a narrow escape when an under-construction iron bridge on the rivulet collapsed at the Jetpur-Kevdi eco-tourism site managed by the forest department in Mandvi taluka of Surat district Tuesday afternoon.

Nearly 30 people sustained injuries and were shifted to the government hospitals in Mandvi and Bardoli town for treatment. While majority of the injured were discharged after primary treatment, five people with fractures in their legs and hands were discharged on Wednesday.

The Jetpur-Kevdi eco-tourism site, witnessed a heavy rush of tourist due to the holiday on Dhuleti festival on Tuesday. According to forest officials more than 3,000 people visited the site on that day.

The bridge collapse occurred at about 12.30pm when about 30 people were standing on the under construction bridge to take selfies and photographs.

Sources said that the visitors were warned by the eco-development committee members on not using the under construction bridge.

Talking with TOI, deputy conservator of forest (Surat range), Puneet Nayyar said, “The construction work of the low-level bridge was on when it collapsed due to overload. The bridge was just 15-feet in height from the ground and thus there was no major injury to the tourists.”

Nayyar added, “An inquiry has been ordered into the incident as to how the visitors got access to the under construction bridge. The work had not been completed and that the stability check of the structure was yet to be performed. Strict action will be taken against those responsible for the negligence at the camp site.”

Sub-inspector of Mandvi police station, J S Valavi said, “Few people had suffered fractures and they were treated at the Mandvi and Bardoli hospitals.”

Title: AMC rebuked over stop-gap fireman
Content:
Ahmedabad: The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) was censured by a local court for keeping a fireman as a stopgap employee for 29 long years after recruiting him on a permanent post through a selection process.

After the rebuke, the city civil court last week ordered AMC to make Somabhai Desai a permanent employee and give him all benefits that he is entitled to as a regular full-time employee of the government.

In ordering so, the court said, “Keeping a man in a state of flux for an indefinite time the way AMC did to Plaintiff (Desai) is an unfair labour practice which must be shunned.”

Desai joined AMC’s fire service in 1991,when the civic body undertook recruitment process for 40 persons. Desai was first in the waiting list. When a few selected candidates did not join the service, Desai was selected, but as a stopgap employee only. In 1995, he approached the court against his temporary job status. In 1997, the court ordered AMC not to terminate Desai’s service.

Twenty-five years after Desai approached the court, it finally concluded his case. The court said that AMC had not placed its advertisement on record for 25 years. AMC’s evidence was “arid” against Desai’s case. In fact, AMC commissioner and mayor gave appreciation letter and cash prize to Desai for his outstanding service in 2011.

In its order, the court observed, “It is now twenty-nine years that this man is working with AMC and with an element of uncertainly for all his age. There is no reason for such an uncertainty to continue... AMC is a State. It is not a private employer. AMC ought to accord permanent status to this employee while giving him all benefits that it usually gives to permanent employees.”

Title: SUDA’s Rs 505cr budget for 2020-21 approved
Content:
Surat: The Surat Urban Development Authority (SUDA)’s Rs 505 crore budget for the year 2020-21 was approved in a board meeting on Wednesday.

According to the SUDA officials, it has allocated Rs 40 crore for the outer Ring Road work in the city’s periphery, while Rs 10 crore has been allocated for the solid waste management in villages of its jurisdiction.

During the board meeting, the SUDA decided to give Rs 250 crore to Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) for its Tapi Riverfront project.

The SUDA has also allocated Rs 77.44 crore for various road construction, development and widening of Surat-Dandi Road. Also, Rs 25 crore has been earmarked for housing scheme under the Pradhanmatri Avas Yojna.

Title: IT services firms get H-1B relief in US court
Content:
Lubna Kably | TNN

Mumbai: In what is seen as a major victory for the IT consulting and services sector, a US district on Tuesday overturned the highly restrictive policies issued by the US Citizenship and Immigration Services ( USCIS ).

These policies, enforced by issuing memorandums, cast an onerous burden of proof (RFEs, or requests for evidence) and documentation requirement on companies that placed their employers at third-party client sites. Besides fuelling denials of H-1B visa applications, it also led to delays in processing of H-1B visa applications. H-1B is a popular work visa held by the Indian diaspora working in the technology sector in the US. Sponsoring employers in the IT services sector faced denials not only in case of new H-1B applications filed for prospective employees, but also in cases of visa extensions for existing employees.

Judge Rosemary M Collyer has held as invalid the policy memo issued by the USCIS in February 2018, which imposed burdensome requirements on IT services companies. It has also held as invalid a policy memo dating back to 2010 (referred to as the Neufeld Memo), that had created a new definition of employer-employee relationships. In short, these companies will, for now, not have to comply with the onerous requirement of providing detailed customer contracts and itineraries of employees that are deputed to client sites.

IT services companies had also faced another challenge—the tenure of H-1B visas that were allotted was shrinking. In some cases, it was only for a few weeks or days, as opposed to the permissible three-year period.

The order was passed in the case of ITServe Alliance , a large coalition of IT services companies in the US and several of its member companies. Judge Collyer also held that if the USCIS wishes to grant H-1B approvals for periods of less than the requested three years (or implicitly the period requested), it must articulate the specific reasons for the shorter duration. TOI had covered the petition that had been filed by the alliance and its member companies (many of which are run by Indian-Americans) in its edition of May 15, 2019.

Responding to the order, ITServe Alliance national president (for 2020) Amar Vanda said, “A decision like this has been long overdue. We finally have the judicial system agreeing with the employers that the USCIS has been out of bounds for a long time.”

Nasscom vice-president (global trade development) Shivendra Singh said, “We welcome the ruling. Slowing of visa processing for IT consulting businesses is a huge concern. The judge has pointed out that it exceeded law in the formal ruling. Between 2015-19, the denial rates shot up from 6% to 24% and for some individual companies, it has gone up to 50%. The key issue here is addressing the skill gap. And a short-term visa is used to fill that critical skill-gap catering to 75% of Fortune 500 companies. And if the process slows down, it nullifies the whole objective.”

Speaking to TOI, Cyrus Mehta, founder of a New York-based immigration law firm, said, “The decision applies common sense and sweeps away the nonsensical rules that the government has imposed on employers with the aim of killing this industry. Even H-1B workers will benefit as they can have more stability and enjoy predictability when they apply for H-1B extensions.”

Arlington-based Rajiv S Khanna, managing attorney at Immigration.com, said, “The order holds that the USCIS must not administer justice through random policy memoranda and, if it wishes to change the regulations, do so through a formal process. In fact, the USCIS seems to have illegally targeted the IT services sector.”

ITServe’s advisory director Kishore Khandavallim added, “Rather than implementing the rule of the law, the USCIS has resorted to random rule-making through internal ‘memos’. It’s game over and checkmate!” The USCIS had required assignment of day-to-day tasks to show that an employer-employee relationship existed. This resulted in challenges where an employer deputed its personnel to work on projects at client sites. The court’s decision now removes this hurdle. “Under the regulations, an employer should not be required to prove their control. Any one of these factors are enough— ability to hire, pay, fire, supervise ‘or’ otherwise control the work of the employee,” explained Khanna. In recent years, several H-1B petitions or even visa extensions for the same job are being denied by the USCIS, claiming the occupation is not a ‘speciality occupation’. “There are indications in this decision that the court is not buying the USCIS’ restrictive interpretation of speciality occupation. The USCIS is likely to lose many more cases on this issue,” Khanna added.

A recent analysis by the National Foundation for America Policy (NFAP) had shown that the denial rates for many IT services companies for new H-1B petitions had risen from about 2% in fiscal 2015 to over 30% in fiscal 2019. Both IT services companies that were multinationals and hired technology workers from India and companies that were headquartered in India suffered this high rate of denials.

The Trump administration can challenge this order in a higher court, but immigration experts think the IT services sector stands on a solid footing. Mehta summed up by saying, “This is a significant victory as the USCIS can no longer deny cases based on the alleged lack of an employer-employee relationship, or lack of a specific contract with the end client or based on speculative employment due to lack of a precise itinerary or time table. This victory will benefit IT service and consulting companies who have been subject to all kinds of arbitrary denials of H-1B requests when they placed workers with third-party clients, which is a legitimate business model and benefits corporate America.”

Title: Flipkart staff to work from home for 3 days
Content: Digbijay Mishra | TNNBengaluru: In a precautionary move amid the coronavirus outbreak, Flipkart has made it mandatory for staff at its Bellandur campus in Bengaluru to work from home for three days, starting Wednesday.The e-tailer’s largest campus houses 8,000-10,000 employees, who are working from home as part of the “dry-run” of day-to-day operations of the Walmart-owned company in the wake of Covid-19. Unlike Paytm, there are no confirmed Covid-19 cases in Flipkart yet. Paytm, which said one of its staff in Gurgaon had tested positive after coming back from Italy — the worst affected country outside China — had shut its offices last week across Noida and Gurgaon.The e-tailer is undertaking this exercise to ensure its critical functions and technology operate effectively in case of an emergency. In a memo to employees, Flipkart also told executives that have travelled abroad recently and have flu-like symptoms to not report to the office for 14 days and consult their managers. PhonePe, the group’s payments arm, will see 50-60% of its staff working from home starting Thursday at least for a week, a person aware of the matter said. PhonePe has around 1,200 employees.“Our BCP (business continuity plan) takes into account the potential risks a situation like Covid-19 can have on our strategic operations and our customer obligations. This trial is mandatory and we request your cooperation in helping us implement the same,” Flipkart told its employees. The company has noted that for the dry-run to be effective, employees should not postpone meetings, campaigns and regular work to a later date, “but use digital tools available to collaborate with teams and executive work”.The customer experience team of the company will work from partner locations and relevant details will be shared with them by their managers. This comes at a time when two employees of Dell and Mindtree have tested positive in Bengaluru and as of Tuesday, the tech-capital had four confirmed cases of Covid-19.“We are checking system preparedness for working remotely using digital/video tools,” a Flipkart spokesperson told TOI on its three-day mandatory work-from-home directive.Covid-19 is also impacting business and supply-chain management for Flipkart and its rival Amazon. Last week, TOI reported how both these companies are trying to minimise the disruption in securing various goods that come from China. The effects might be visible next month — on availability and pricing. An Amazon spokesperson said it is, among other standard measures, letting people work from home if unwell. In a separate statement, Flipkart said it is sanitising its facilities and getting them deep cleaned at regular intervals in light of Covid-19. It added it is also raising awareness among its delivery executives since they have direct exposure to consumers.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: Flight from Yangon lands in Gaya with no passenger
Content:
