All suspects who were quarantined in the GMC last week were discharged after their test reports came negative for the virus.Meanwhile, health minister Vishwajit Rane said he has told chief secretary Parimal Rai to instruct government departments to procure face masks and hand sanitizers as a precautionary measure. “The health secretary has also been asked to speak to secretaries of the various departments to procure masks and sterillium for their staff,” he said.Similar directions were also issued to hospitals, he said. “Security guards at entry points have been told to request visitors to sanitize their hands before entering hospital premises. Nurses and other medical staff should wear masks,” Rane said.Stating that Covid-19 cases around the world have been “growing exponentially”, the health minister said proactive steps had to be taken to thwart its spread. He reiterated that people avoid large gatherings. “People should wear masks while travelling or while in a crowd,” he said.

Title: Rajkot nephrologists’s article recognized by American journal
Content:
Dr Sanjay Pandya

Rajkot: In its journal published this month , the American Society of Nephrology (ASN) has recognized the tireless efforts of Dr Sanjay Pandya, a Rajkot-based nephrologist who , for the past 10 years , have been single-mindedly engaged in spreading awareness about preventing kidney diseases.

“It’s one of the highest recognition for a kidney doctor to get his work published and appreciated by ASN. It has 22,000 active members worldwide and is the world’s largest professional society committed to the study of kidney diseases,” said Dr Pandya, while talking to TOI on the backdrop of World Kidney Day, observed on the second Thursday of March.

According to Dr Pandya, his work had been selected for publication because this year’s theme is: “Kidney health for everyone, everywhere”.

Pandya, who has been running a kidney education foundation since 2006, has also published a book on the subject in Gujarati, which was later translated in Hindi to reach out to the masses. In 2010, he launched a portal where he uploaded the contents of the book. Over the last decade, Dr Pandya has been continuously providing various contents on his portal on information, education and prevention measures in 37 languages including 20 foreign languages like Arabic, Filipino, Korean, Russian, Spanish, Thai, Persian, Serbian, Swahili, Turkish, and German. The portal has generated 70 million hits in the past 10 years.

According to Institute of Kidney Diseases and Research Centre (IKDRC) Ahmedabad in 2019 total 390 transplantation took place out of that 89 are cadaver, the current waiting list is 350. Dr Pandya believes that delayed knowledge of kidney diseases proves disastrous not only for the patient, but the entire family. This calls for aggressive dissemination of prevention-related awareness, he said.

Title: 9 women go missing every 2 days in city
Content: Gandhinagar: On average, nine women of all age groups go missing from Ahmedabad city every two days, and one teen in the 14-18 age group goes missing daily.In the tabled reply to a question from Dariapur MLA Gyasuddin Shaikh, the government said that over the past two years — 2018 and 2019 — 3,421 women went missing from Ahmedabad city, of whom 2,971 have been found.The government said that in Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar districts (including Ahmedabad city and Gandhinagar city) 112 children in the age group of 0-10 years went missing and of these 95 have been found. In the age group of 10-14 years, 172 went missing and 160 have been found. The government said that in the age group of 14-18 years, 871 went missing and 788 were found. The government that many children below 10 go missing after they fail in an examination or are scolded by their parents. The government said that in some cases, women eloped taking their children along with them.The government said that its teams along with NGOs search for the missing children. .

Title: Kerala minister denies lapses in identifying coronavirus-affected
Content:
A private hospital employee, carrying samples for testing coronavirus, outside Government Medical College, Ern... Read More

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The government has ruled out any lapses on its part in identifying the three Pathanamthitta natives who arrived from Italy, and were affected by Covid-19. Health minister K K Shailaja said in the assembly that there are limitations for the government in identifying all such passengers unless they honestly declare their travel details.

Replying to a submission in this regard by opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala, the minister said the passengers who had arrived from Italy had not disclosed their travel to Italy. Instead, they said that they came back from Doha which was then not under screening. The minister said that the containment method followed by the government is effective, and the health department and its staff is working hard to locate till the last person who came in contact with the three-member family after reaching home.

Even though the department is doing its best to contain the virus and other states have lauded and decided to emulate the state’s best practices, it cannot be assured that there will not be any deaths in the state due to Covid-19. “We did not have any protocol or guidelines. We have created one on our own with the best use of resources available to us,” the minister said.

The minister said that there are 1,495 persons under surveillance in the state, of which 1,236 are in home quarantine and 259 in hospitals. She said that out of 980 samples that have been tested, 815 have been found to be negative while 14 of those returned from Italy and three from China have been found positive. The minister said that as many as 18 teams have been deployed in Pathanamthitta for identifying persons with symptoms of Covid-19. She said that a 166-member team is dedicated in tracing the contacts of those who have come into touch with the Italy-returned family while 68 health department officials are involved in isolation activities only in Pathanamthitta.

Cial denies claims of family

The three-member Covid-19 virus-affected family in Ranni, who have arrived at Kochi airport from Italy on February 29, had claimed that they were unaware of health counters and have informed immigration department about their travel from Italy. The Cochin International Airport Limited (Cial) officials has denied their claims, saying the family skipped the checking at health counter and hid the fact they were coming from Italy. After checking CCTV footages, the CIAL officials said while all other passengers in the flight reported at the health counters, this particular family did not approach the health officials.

Title: School closure tweet fake
Content:
Panaji: The chief minister’s office (CMO) has said that a screenshot of a tweet circulating on social media as one posted by CM Pramod Sawant is fake. The tweet shows Sawant announcing that the education department has declared the closure of all institutes due to the Covid-19 scare.

“No such tweet has been made by the CM,” a statement from the CMO read. It warned that many such tweets have been circulating and urged citizens to exercise caution.

“The CMO has clarified that no such tweet or messages have been made by the chief minister and screenshots like these should be cross-checked with the official Facebook and Twitter profiles for their authenticity before being forwarded,” the CMO’s statement added.

Title: Pilibhit farmers protest against curbs on summer paddy
Content:
Pilibhit: Farmers in Pilibhit are resisting the restrictions on cultivation of summer paddy imposed by the district magistrate through an administrative order issued on December 29, 2019.

Restraining the farmers from transplanting summer paddy from this season, the district magistrate had also directed 14 departmental heads to ensure that farmers do not cultivate the particular crop in any part of the district. In addition, the agriculture department has been told to motivate farmers to replace summer paddy with pulses and maize. Defying orders, the farmers under Pilibhit tehsil circle have started transplanting summer paddy on their fields from Tuesday. The farmers have also filed a petition to Allahabad high court to repeal the DM’s order.

Notably, summer paddy is a crop that is transplanted in March to ripe in May. In absence of any monsoon rain during these months, the crop completely survives on underground water as it is irrigated with the help of pumping sets. The administrative restrictions on this crop were swayed by the thought to save the sub-soil water from any further depletion. According to an estimate, summer paddy is grown in Pilibhit across an area of around 30,000 hectare.

“I have filed a writ petition to HC on March 4 challenging the restriction on summer paddy imposed by the district administration. HC’s decision is expected on March 18. How can the administration debar farmers from choosing a cropping pattern which is neither prohibited by any court, government nor by the national green tribunal?” stated Chaudahary Dharmendra Singh, a farmer of Pachpeda under Puranpur tehsil circle.

A local farmer of Baivaha under Pilibhit tehsil circle, Harpreet Singh Chabba, told TOI that he assembled over 200 farmers on Tuesday and began transplantation of summer paddy at his own farm. “Summer paddy is a crucial source of our earnings, especially to repay our bank loans on time and thus to avert the recovery proceedings of the respective banks,” said Shankar Rai, the husband of Deepali Rai, the woman gram pradhan of Gabhiya Sahrai under Kalinagar tehsil circle.

Meanwhile, tehsildar of Pilibhit sadar, Vivek Kumar Mishra said that Chabba and other violators have been given a two-day ultimatum which would expire on Thursday.

Title: Woman raped, blackmailed, branded in private parts
Content:
Representative Image

RAJKOT: A sordid case of a married woman subjected to unimaginable brutality and sexual assault has come to light in Kutch after police arrested her tormentor on Tuesday.

The arrested person Mansukh Koli (30) not only raped her repeatedly, but also brutalized her by branding her private parts. He did not stop at this. Koli filmed the entire act of rape and branding on his mobile and started using the video to extract money from her.

“In the last six months, Koli blackmailed her into giving Rs 1.5 lakh including her ornaments. He raped the woman in her father’s farm in a village of Rapar taluka,” said KG Zala, deputy superintendent of police, Rapar.

Koli threatened to upload the video on social media. Even as she constantly pleaded with him to let her go and wailed, Koli remained unmoved and even thrashed her.

“The woman was tortured for nearly six months. We had formed five teams to track down Koli after the video somehow started circulating on Whatsapp and social media,” Zala added.

The police teams also tracked down the woman and convinced her to lodge a complaint against Koli.

“Once the complaint was lodged, we launched a manhunt for Koli. Meanwhile, Koli went absconding after learning about the police action against him. We tracked him down in the Little Rann of Kutch after he switched on his cellphone to send a message,” said Zala.

In her complaint, the woman alleged that Koli had raped her at knife point and had shot a video of the act while she was working in her father’s farm six months ago.

He had raped her several times in the past six months. Koli is married and has two children, police said.

Title: Gujarat: Nearly five women raped every day in state, says government
Content: GANDHINAGAR: Gujarat reported nearly four rapes every day in the two years beginning January 1, 2018. The state reported 2,723 rape cases, of which 41 were incidents of gang-rape, while 35 involved girls younger than five years old.The state government, in a tabled reply, stated that of the 2,723 rape cases, 1,763 involved victims in the six to 18-year age group. Surat had the most rape cases involving very young girls, with 13 incidents where the victims were girls younger than five. Surat city was followed by Ahmedabad city, Ahmedabad rural, Rajkot rural and Bharuch with three girls younger than 5 were raped in two years in each of these jurisdictions.Minister of state for home Pradipsinh Jadeja, in reply to a question from Modasa Congress MLA Rajendrasinh Thakore, said, “Gujarat is not the rape capital of the country. Incident of rapes are just 1.7% of total crimes in the state, which the figure is 12.7% across the country. Gujarat ranks 31st and is among the bottom states in terms of rapes.”The minister said a high-level committee to address crime against women has been formed headed by the ACS (home) which includes the DGP. The committee reviews such cases once a fortnight.The minister said in cities especially, girls of the 16-18 years age group elope and rape cases are registered in such instances.” The minister said that in the majority of such cases, the families of the girls and boy who had eloped work out a compromise when they return.The minister said that for the Modasa case where a woman was gang-raped, the minister said that a special investigation team has been formed and the government has arrested three persons.

Title: Rise in malaria cases in Bareilly & Budaun in past two months
Content:
Bareilly: Bareilly and Budaun districts witnessed an increase of 83% and 77%, respectively, in the number of malaria cases in the past two months, as compared to January and February 2019.

A total of 414 patients tested positive in Bareilly district in January and February 2020 – compared to 226 people during the same period last year. Similarly, Budaun reported 214 malaria cases in the past two months, this year, while the number was 121 last year. Both districts reported malaria outbreak in 2018 and 2019.

Joint director (malaria) Dr Awadhesh Yadav said, “The number of cases has gone up. We have screened more cases this time in comparison to last year. For instance, the blood slide examination of 7,288 suspected cases was conducted in Bareilly district in January and February 2019 while 18,339 people were screened for malaria during the same period this year. We are working as per the guidelines of government of India and our aim is to detect each and every person carrying malaria parasite and treat them.”

According to data available with the health department, of the total 414 cases reported in Bareilly this year, 167 cases were diagnosed in January while 247 people were tested positive with malaria in February. In Budaun district, 91 cases of malaria were reported in January this year while 123 cases of malaria were detected in February this year.

Health officials said people of two malaria-hit districts - Bareilly and Budaun - are being detected with two types of malaria - plasmodium falciparum (PF) which is “deadly” form of malaria and plasmodium vivax (PV) which is milder form of malaria.

Though total cases of malaria have increased in the past two months in comparison to same period in 2019, officials said Bareilly district has reported increase in PV cases and decrease in PF cases. Senior officials said 135 PV cases and 91 PF cases were reported in January and February 2019 in Bareilly district, but Bareilly recorded 370 PV and 44 PF cases up to February this year.

Bareilly district malaria officer D R Singh said, “We have received nearly 30,000 long lasting insecticide nets (LLINs) which ASHA and ANM will distribute in PF affected villages from next month. LLINs are mosquito nets with coating of insecticides and it kills mosquito when it sits on such nets.”

Officials said households where maximum number of members was tested positive with malaria last year will get priority in receiving LLIN.

Title: Sonu Dangar, her gang of nine booked under GCTOC
Content:
Rajkot: Notorious history-sheeter Sonal alias Sonu Dangar and eight others were booked under Gujarat Control of Terrorism and Organized Crime (GCTOC) Act for running an ‘organized crime syndicate’ for over a decade by the Savarkundla police of Amreli district.

Apart from Dangar, Shivraj Vichhiya, Shailesh Chandu, Dadu Chandu, Ashok Boricha, Balsinh Boricha, Vanraj Vala, Narendra Khuman and Gautam Khuman were booked under various sections of the GCTOC Act on Monday night at the Savarkundla rural police station.

A special investigation team (SIT) has also been formed by the Amreli superitendent of police Nirlipt Rai to investigate the case. SIT probe is headed by deputy SP K J Chaudhary with probationer ASP Sushil Agarwal as his assistant.

“This is the first case under GCTOC in Amreli after the act was enacted in Gujarat,” said R K Karmata, sub-inspector with Amreli local crime branch.

Of those booked, Dangar and Vichhiya are the gang leaders, who had spread their crime syndicate in districts like Amreli, Bhavnagar, Rajkot, Gir Somnath and Junagadh. The gang is allegedly involved in crimes ranging from murder, attempt to murder and extortion to kidnapping, money laundering, land grabbing and arms dealing, said Karmata, adding that the gang was also involved in smuggling of arms and explosives.

Dangar and her gang members have been ‘continuing unlawful activity’ despite several chargesheets filed against them for various offences, said Karmata.

Dangar was last year arrested for circulated a video on the social media in which she is threatening Amreli superintendent of police Nirlipt Rai and a woman sub-inspector of Savarkundla police station.

In the video, Dangar was apparently angry over arrest of her close aide Vichhiya held under Prohibition Act after he was caught in a liquor party by Ahmedabad police. Later, the Ahmedabad police handed over Vichhiya’s custody to Amreli police.

After Savarkundla taluka police station officials registered an offence in this regard, Dangar was traced to a hotel in Udaipur in Rajasthan and arrested on December 22 last year.

Of those booked under GCTOC, six accused including Dangar, Vichhiya, Balsinh Boricha, Narendra Khuman, Gautam Khuman and Dadu Chandu are lodged in different jails of Gujarat.

However, Vala, Ashok Boricha and Shailesh Chandu out on bail. “We have intensified our manhunt for the remaining accused, and we hope to nab them soon,” said Karmata.

Title: Four foreign residents of ashram studied at DPS East sans papers
Content:
Ahmedabad: Four of the 24 children who lived at the Nithyananda Ashram and studied at the Delhi Public School (East), were foreign nationals and the school had no documentation in this regard, the state government told the Gujarat high court on Wednesday.

An affidavit filed by the Ahmedabad district education officer R R Vyas stated that four children were not Indian nationals and these known foreign nationals were living at the ashram on the school campus without documentation. They were among the 24 students who were shifted along with the ashram to Ahmedabad.

The DEO listed the alleged illegalities and irregularities by the school in the Hathijan area that led to the cancellation of its recognition. This came in reply to the school’s plea in the HC, challenging the government action against it.

The DEO stated that of the 24 students from the Nithyananda ashram, 18 did not produce transfer certificates and eight students did not supply birth certificates. The DEO cited the school’s action of allowing use of its campus by the Nithyananda ashram as an irregularity.

The DEO cited the alleged forged NOC, the de-affiliation of the school by the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) and the use of the school building since 2008 without ‘Building Use’ permission as reasons for the government’s decision to de-recognize and close the school. Education officials stated that school authorities were granted ample opportunity to explain their side with show-cause notices issued to them on various occasions, but the school management did not come forward to explain the alleged irregularities and illegalities. The affidavit also maintains that the school management has yet not challenged the DEO’s decision before the competent authority and it approached the HC before exhausting alternative remedies. Hence, the school’s petition is not maintainable, the government asserted.

Title: Youth shot by girl’s father over ‘affair’
Content:
Pilibhit: A 24-year-old man of Sahukara locality in Puranpur city under Puranpur Kotwali police station was shot at by the father of a girl with whom he was allegedly having an affair.

The girl’s father alleged that the “youth was blackmailing his daughter for over a month and when he came to play Holi with her and did not find her at home, he shot himself at his chest with his pistol with intention to commit suicide”.

The police have lodged an FIR against the girl’s father. The youth was first shifted to Puranpur community health centre where he was referred to district government hospital in Pilibhit. But, in view of his critical condition, he was sent to a higher medical facility in Bareilly.

SHO Suresh Kumar Singh said the FIR was registered against the girl’s father under section 307 (attempt to kill) following a written complaint filed by the man’s younger brother.

Title: State to write to MEA about sailors stranded in US
Content: Margao: State commissioner for NRI affairs Narendra Sawaikar on Wednesday said he would write to the MEA and the Indian embassy in the US to ensure the safety of Goan sailors on board a cruise liner, ‘Grand Princess’, which has been quarantined off California since March 9. The ship, carrying 3,500 people, docked in Oakland on Monday. At least 21 people on board are learnt to have been infected. While spokesperson of the Goan Seamen Association of India, Dixon Vaz, said he was unaware of any Goan being stuck on the ship, co-founder of the association, Frank Viegas, said he was trying to confirm the identities of the Goan sailors on board. tnn

Title: Coronavirus scare in Goa: Colleges asked to disinfect frequently touched surfaces
Content: PANAJI: Based on an advisory issued by the University Grants Commission, Goa University has issued preventive measures against Covid-19 to be taken by the varsity’s departments and the affiliated colleges. The Institutes have been told to disinfect all frequently touched surfaces like door knobs, switches, desk top and hand railings.The advisory has also asked the faculty to be alert towards any student with signs and symptoms like fever, cough and difficulty in breathing and have the student tested immediately.Colleges have been told to avoid having large gatherings on campus.“Any student/staff with travel history to any Covid-19 affected country or in contact with such persons in the last 28 days should be monitored and home quarantined for 14 days. Till advised by the treating doctor, the student should not join campus. Faculty, staff and students should also be advised about simple public health measures of hand and respiratory hygiene,” the advisory to colleges states.“Provide alcohol based hand cleaners/sanitisers in frequented spots of the university/colleges. Ensure availability of soaps and water in rest rooms at all times. Foot operated pedal bins lined with plastic bag should be provided in each classroom and rest room.“In hostels, health status of students as well as the other ancillary staff should be monitored on regular basis. In case, there are suspected cases, the authorised local medical authority should be called for examination,” reads the advisory.

Title: Tepid response on Day 1, only 24 file nominations
Content:
Visakhapatnam: The first day of the nomination exercise on Wednesday was marked by a poor response. Only 24 candidates from various political parties filed their nominations for the GVMC elections . The lukewarm response has been attributed to the principal political parties, YSRC and TDP, working on the list of candidates.

The reservation process by the district administration reserved 50% of the wards (49 wards) to women candidates while many wards have gone to a different category or community than that of the aspirants/local leaders of that particular ward. These factors have forced the parties to search for new candidates to meet the reservation criteria. The parties are yet to figure out potential candidates, who command influence in their respective community/area and can spend some money on the elections. The delayed candidate selection process is expected to affect the nomination filing.

The maximum number of nominations is expected to be filed on the last day of the nomination exercise — March 13. According to sources, YSRC and TDP may release their lists on Wednesday night or Thursday. VMRDA metropolitan commissioner and GVMC in-charge commissioner P Koteswara Rao have urged aspirants to file their nominations without waiting till March 13.

Meanwhile, Rao visited Zone-V office in Gajuwaka to monitor arrangements for the GVMC polls. He asked officials to set up sufficient signage for voters. GVMC additional commissioner Thameem Ansariya visited Zone-II and Zone-III offices.

Later, both IAS officers inspected the Andhra University Engineering College buildings, which may be used for various election purposes.

Title: Course correction: Colvale jailbirds to get skill training
Content:
Panaji: Come June, inmates at the Colvale Central Jail will be able to sign up for technical courses such as plumbing and carpentry for the duration of their sentence. Goa’s jail administration has tied up with local industrial training institutes and will also hire instructors in the coming months to impart the training to jail inmates, said inspector general of prisons (IGP) Gurudas Pilarnekar.

He said that female inmates will also be able to opt for tailoring courses as part of the ongoing efforts to rehabilitate offenders.

“New courses are being started at the jail. Plumbing and other courses like stitching and tailoring for women will be started,” said Pilarnekar. “A jail is not supposed to be just a prison, but a correctional facility.”

There are around 553 inmates housed at the jail, including 35 women. Other courses like papad-making and cooking are also in the works.

At a later stage, inmates will also be given training as fitters and welders. A proposal to teach electrical training to the inmates was not approved because of the risks involved. ITI instructors will help impart the training but the department also plans to recruit full-time instructors for some courses, said officials. The Colvale Central Jail already has a bakery where cakes, cookies, biscuits and patties are prepared and served to the inmates.

Additional IGP Ashutosh Apte said that the aim behind the exercise was to rehabilitate those behind bars and provide them with a means to earn a livelihood once they are released.

Title: Parties wrestle over seat sharing in municipal polls
Content:
Vijayawada: With major political still finalising their candidates, the nomination process witnessed poor response on the first day. On Wednesday, 17 candidates from filed their nominations for the upcoming elections to the Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC).

Around 18 nominations were filed on the first day of the nomination process.

Senior TDP leader and former mayor Gogula Ramana Rao and former corporator Devineni Aparna were among those who filed nominations on Wednesday. Some candidates filed multiple sets of nominations.

VMC authorities arranged voter lists and handbooks on model code of conduct at RO offices and gave them to every candidate filing for nomination.

Meanwhile, political parties intensified exercise on the selection of the candidates. Telugu Desam party and the Communist Party of India (CPI) conducted a series of meetings on seat sharing at Kesineni Bhavan in the city on Wednesday. Multiple aspirants for a single ward has become a major concern for TDP. A few key leaders were in talks with aspirants over the alliance with CPI and convincing them to stay away from the fight.

Similarly, Jana Sena and BJP are in a fix over seat-sharing. Pothina Venkata Mahesh, Jana Sena’s local bodies’ co-ordinator conducted a series of meetings with aspirants and tried to convince them to support BJP.

Title: Will respond after reading the HC order fully: Narayanasamy
Content: Puducherry: Chief minister V Narayanasamy said he will respond to the verdict of a bench of the Madras high court that set aside the single judge order restraining lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi from interfering in the day-to-day affairs of the elected government and suggesting Raj Nivas and the government work in unison after ‘reading the order fully’. “It is a lengthy verdict. I must read the order fully before making any remarks. I will give a detailed response later,” Narayanasamy said. Bedi and the Congress government headed by Narayanasamy have been on the loggerheads over several issues and their tussle reached the Supreme Court and the Madras high court. Recently, the Madras high court passed orders in favour of Bedi in the free rice scheme and in the appointment of state election commissioner after Narayanasamy and local administration minister A Namassivayam filed petitions against her decisions.

Title: Many vying for Congress Rajya Sabha nominations
Content:
Gandhinagar: While the Congress grapples with the problem of too many contenders for the two Rajya Sabha seats from Gujarat it will theoretically win, the BJP says it will try to get three or four Congress MLAs to defect to snatch three of the four seats that are up from grabs in the state.

The Congress in the 2017 assembly elections increased its tally of MLAs compared to 2012 and thus can win two of the four Rajya Sabha seats up for election on March 26. The BJP presently holds three of these four seats.

The BJP on Wednesday announced two nominees. However, there are indications that the party will field three candidates. A BJP leader said, “Our party puts up a keen fight even at taluka-level elections. There is no question of letting one Rajya Sabha seat slip out of our hands.”

The leader added, “Two Bharatiya Tribal Party (BTP) MLAs and one NCP MLA have already announced support to us. A dozen Congress MLAs are keen to defect to the BJP. However, at this point, we may accept the support of three or four Congress MLAs only, which will enable us to win the third RS seat.”

No clarity over Priyanka Gandhi’s nomination from Gujarat

Like other states, Gujarat Congress has also requested its central leadership to nominate general secretary Priyanka Gandhi-Vadra for the RS from Gujarat. However, the state leadership has no clarity about whether she will file her nomination papers from Gujarat.

Congress bigwigs seek RS ticket

More than two dozen Congress leaders sought tickets for the the two Rajya Sabha seats the party is set to win. Past GPCC presidents Bharatsinh Solanki, Arjun Modhwadia and Siddharth Patel, national party office bearers Shaktisinh Gohil and Dipak Babaria, sitting MP Madhusudan Mistry and a number of other senior leaders have sought RS tickets, party sources said. A few leaders have also reportedly threatened to join the BJP if they are not considered this time.

Title: YSRC, TDP battle it out for mayor’s seat
Content:
Visakhapatnam: The post of mayor is one that will be keenly contested by the YSR Congress ( YSRC ) and the Telugu Desam Party ( TDP ) in the municipal elections to the Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation ( GVMC ). At stake is the proposal to make the city the executive capital.

The capital issue is expected to be a key campaign plank for the YSRC while the TDP claims that establishing the executive capital in Visakhapatnam will encourage land encroachments and anti-social activities.

In spite of the YSRC’s victory in the state assembly elections, the party could not win any seat in Vizag core city. With several leaders such as former minister P Balaraju and former MLA Ch Venkatramaiah recently shifting their loyalty to the YSRC, the party is hoping to take over the reins of the civic body.

The selection of candidates and campaign strategies is being closely monitored by YSRC MPs and MLAs.

The TDP, with four MLAs in the core city area, has retained its key leaders. It was learnt that the final call on the mayoral candidate will be made by party president N Chandrababu Naidu but party leaders in the city are keen on fielding a former MLA as the candidate.

Speaking to TOI, Visakhapatnam Metropolitan Region Development Authority chairman and senior YSRC leader Dronamraju Srinivasa Rao said making Visakhapatnam the executive capital would change north-coastal AP, and particularly the city.

A TDP leader said the state’s development has been jeopardised under YSRC rule. “We will explain to the public how YS Jaganmohan Reddy’s rule has wreaked havoc,” said the leader.

Title: Congress feels 13 Scindia loyalists will return, DK Shivakumar on rescue op

Congress MLAs including six state ministers from Madhya Pradesh who are in Bengaluru, tender their resignation... Read More

Early in the day, two buses were called to CM House from where the MLAs and ministers - smiling and flashing 'V' signs - were moved to the airport, where a chartered plane was waiting to fly them to Congress-ruled Jaipur. Members of the Ashok Gehlot government took them into their care there.

Minister for co-operatives Dr Govind Singh and minister for animal husbandry Lakhan Singh Yadav filed a disqualification petition against six ministers of the Scindia faction who are presently in Bengaluru. "They are ministers of a Congress government but are benefiting another political party. They flew in their plane and have been lodged in a resort by BJP and are trying to bring down the Congress government. These are all on record. This makes ground for their disqualification as members of the legislative assembly. The Speaker can take the decision to disqualify them," he said. The Speaker said he will wait till the ministers return and submit the resignation personally.

Title: ‘Denied treatment by CGHS hosps’
Content:
Visakhapatnam: The All Central Government Employees Pensioners ’ Association (ACGEPA) – Vizag (AP) chapter has submitted a representation to the additional secretary and director general of Central Government Health Scheme (CGHS) and to Visakhapatnam MP MVV Satyanarayana for taking necessary action with regards to denial of treatment to patients at CGHS empanelled hospitals.

Members of ACGEPA, representing around 5,000 pensioners, in their complaint letter stated there are 31 empanelled hospitals in the city and some of these corporate hospitals are declining cashless treatment to CGHS beneficiaries on the plea on non-recoupment of hospital credit bills, which runs into crores of rupees. CGHS beneficiaries are facing constraints in availing both inpatient and outpatient treatment, said KBR Prasad, president of the association.

“We have represented the issue regularly in CGHS advisory committee meetings and written letters to additional director, CGHS, Hyderabad and director general of CGHS, New Delhi to resolve this issue. CGHS is not a free health scheme but the pensioners have joined CGHS by paying a lumpsum amount as per slabs, ranging from Rs 30,000 to Rs 1,20,000 besides losing their monthly fixed medical allowance (FMA) of Rs 1,000 per month,” added M Chandrasekhara Rao, general secretary of ACGEPA.

Title: TDP picks Kesineni’s daughter Swetha as mayoral candidate
Content:
Vijayawada: TDP has cleared the name of Kesineni Swetha as mayoral candidate for Vijayawada. Swetha, daughter of Vijayawada MP Kesineni Srinivas (Nani), had played a key role for TDP in 2019 general elections.

TDP, which has focused on encouraging youth in politics, has decided to give a chance to young candidates as mayor and counsellors for municipalities and municipal corporations. The party has decided to announce mayoral candidates before the polls and make them star campaigners across the wards.

Swetha studied psychology at Emory University, Atlanta, the US. She campaigned for Hillary Clinton during the 2017 US presidential elections. She was one of the keynote speakers at the National Women’s Parliament held at Vijayawada in 2017.

Following the annoucement, key TDP leaders expressed their happiness over the selection of Swetha as the mayoral candidate for Vijayawada.

Linagamaneni Sivarama Prasad, senior leader from the city said, “We welcome young blood to the party. These leaders are the future of the state. Swetha proved herself as a dedicated party leader by participating in election campaigns. We are confident that we will win 75% of wards and Swetha will be sworn in as the mayor of the city.”

Swetha is likely to file her nomination from the 11th division of the city. The party is planning to conduct a huge rally from the NTR circle as part of the nomination process.

Meanwhile, senior party leaders have swung into action to pacify colleagues who expected to be picked for the mayor’s post.

Vijayawada city mayoral post is reserved for a women from the general category. The election for the city mayor will be held on March 29.

Title: 64-year-old gold appraiser defrauds bank of Rs 6.71 crore
Content:
Vijayawada: Police have begun investigating into a Rs 6.71-crore gold loan fraud at Central Bank of India’s Chilakalapudi branch in Krishna district.

The fraud came to light a few weeks ago, but police registered a case against the bank’s 64-year-old gold appraiser Macherla Satya Vara Prasad Rao only on Tuesday night following a complaint from senior regional manager of the bank Vinod Pophale spelling out the exact amount siphoned off.

Machilipatnam-based Satya Vara Prasad Rao has been serving as gold appraiser for the bank for the past two decades. The gold, which was appraised by Rao and pledged by 68 individuals, was found to be imitation jewellery during an internal investigation.

Bank authorities issued a paper publication on March 1, 2020, advising gold loan borrowers to be present for verification of ornaments from March 1 to 7. A majority of the genuine gold loan borrowers visited the bank.

However, some individuals, who reportedly pledged fake gold and availed loans against it didn’t turn up for verification. Some even denied availing loans from the bank during investigation.

The internal investigation has revealed that Rao connived with a few gold loan borrowers and sanction loans from the bank’s Chilakalapudi branch.

Sources said the fraud came to light following a tip-off that some people had availed loans by pledging fake jewellery with the support of the gold appraiser. The amount swindled is estimated to be Rs 6.71 crore and a majority of the sum was taken by the appraiser himself.

Speaking to TOI, Chilakalapudi inspector M Venkata Narayana said they had registered a case against Satya Vara Prasad Rao under Sections 120 (B), 409, 420 and R/W 34 of IPC. Chilakalapudi police, along with Central Crime Station police, are on the look out for Rao, Narayana said.

Title: ‘Candidates yet to receive electronic electoral rolls’
Content:
Panaji: Congress continued to accuse the BJP government and State Election Commission (SEC) of deliberately “creating trouble for Congress candidates” contesting the zilla panchayat (ZP) elections.

State Congress president Girish Chodankar even wrote to the SEC complaining that their candidates have not received the electoral rolls in electronic format and that booth level officers were not creating awareness about the polls.

“For the upcoming ZP elections, electoral rolls have been provided with a lot of delay and secondly the rolls have not been provided in electronic mode as result of which voters slips have to be prepared manually, which is taking a lot of man hours in a situation where there is already paucity of time,” Chodankar said.

Congress has asked the SEC to ensure that booth level officers distribute voter slips and create voter awareness to ensure maximum voter turnout. “The endeavour of the election commission is to have free and fair elections and to have maximum voter turnout. But the BJP government is trying its best to trouble the Congress,” Chodankar said. The party president was speaking after chairing the state Congress executive committee meeting. The committee and office bearers met to discuss the preparations for the ZP elections.

Opposition leader Digambar Kamat, expressed confidence over the party’s prospects in the elections. Kamat brushed aside suggestions that Congress MLAs, especially Curtorim MLA Aleixo Reginaldo Lourenco, had not been consulted during the candidate selection process.

Title: Kutch cop held for extortion, seeking sexual favours from woman
Content:
Representative Image

PALANPUR: A head constable currently posted at Gandhidham police station in Kutch was remanded to five-day police custody by a local court here on Wednesday after he was arrested on Tuesday for extortion and sexual assault on a woman.

Mukesh Darji, who has recently transferred to Kutch district, was arrested following complaint by a woman in her early 20s.

According to the woman’s complaint, she came in touch with Darji in 2017 when she had applied for police recruitment. Darji used to help her in physical training. While training, she used to keep her mobile phone with Darji.

However, Darji transferred some private photos from the woman’s mobile phone to his phone. He also assured the woman to help her clear the police exam and get her selected in 2018.

Later, Darji, blackmailed the woman by showing her private photos with a male friend on his mobile phone. He threatened to make the pictures viral and demanded sexual favours.

He also demanded Rs 5 lakh from the woman’s male friend by threatening to show the pictures to his wife and relatives. The male friend allegedly paid Rs 8 lakh to Darji in two instalments.

At the same time Darji continued to demand sexual favours from the complainant woman. Tired of the constant harassment, the woman lodged police complaint, following which Darji was arrested under sections 354 and 509 of the Indian Penal Code .

Title: No repeat of MP ‘drama’ in Rajasthan, says Congress
Content:
Rajasthan deputy CM Sachin Pilot

JAIPUR: The Congress leaders in Rajasthan decried the claim of some BJP leaders that Madhya Pradesh ’s political ‘ drama ’ could be repeated in the desert state. The Congress leaders here said that the BJP would do good to keep its own flock together.

Some BJP leaders are comparing MP situation in the context of relationship between chief minister Ashok Gehlot and his deputy Sachin Pilot. Pilot’s silence over Scindia action was also adding fuel to fire.

Pilot who was in Delhi, however, breaking his silence on the issue on Wednesday night in a tweet said, “Unfortunate to see @JM_Scindia parting ways with @INCIndia. I wish things could have been resolved collaboratively within the party.”

Former BJP minister Kalicharan Saraf MLA claimed that some Congress MLAs are in touch with the saffron party in Rajasthan.

The Congressmen decried the involvement of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and home minister Amit Shah in the toppling game.

State transport minister Pratap Singh Kachariyawas, while speaking to media, decried the role of the PM. “It is for the first time that the PM, home minister and defence minister conspiring to topple a democratically elected government in a state.”

He said if Scindia had met some BJP leaders before leaving the Congress, it was understandable. But the direct involvement of the prime minister and senior functionaries of government in this toppling game is a new low in the democratic history of the country, he said.

Harish Chaudhary, a senior minister in the Gehlot cabinet, while ruling out any rebellion in the Rajasthan Congress in the state said, “There is no difference within the Rajasthan Congress. The alleged difference over Rajya Sabha seat is a pigment of imagination as the Rajya Sabha seats are yet to be decided.”

Mahendra Chaudhary, party deputy chief whip, said the BJP’s claim of some Congress MLAs are in touch with them is nothing but wishful thinking. Better they keep their flock together, he said.

Title: ‘Was born in BJP, will die in BJP’
Content:
Gandhinagar: Deputy chief minister and senior BJP leader Nitin Patel sought to end all speculation about his political future by stating in the Gujarat assembly that he will remain in the BJP till his death. “I am a loyal soldier of the BJP. I was born in the BJP, and will die in the BJP,” Patel said, amid invitations from Congress leaders, asking him to defect to the Congress along with his loyalists.

Speaking at a function of Umiya Dham recently, Patel triggered a political storm after saying that he was ‘alone on one side, while the rest were on the other side’. Congress leaders twice in the ongoing assembly session invited Nitin Patel to join the Congress with his loyalists and become CM.

Patel on Wednesday said, “I did not speak on this subject in the assembly to maintain the dignity of our opposition party friends. Now I think I have to respond. At the Umiya Dham ceremony, the ‘others’ I referred to were those in the Congress. I mean to say that I am pitted against so many MLAs of the Congress in the house. I am a loyal soldier of the BJP. I was born in BJP, and will die in BJP. Congress is getting split everywhere in the country and its leaders and workers are leaving the party everywhere.” No MLA of the Congress responded to Patel’s clarification.

Assembly proceedings diverted to Nitin Patel after the BJP MLA from Sayajigunj took a dig at the Congress about the political situation in Madhya Pradesh, while asking a question about open university degrees available to convicts in jails. In his reply, minister of state for home Pradipsinh Jadeja said, “The Congress is eyeing the Gujarat CM’s post. This will never happen. Not one MLA will cross over to the Congress. Vijay Rupani is our CM and will remain so. You will never succeed.”

Later, when Khambhat MLA Mahesh Patel asked a question about the Sujalam-Sufalam project, Nitin Patel, in his reply, stood up and clarified his stand on the controversy.

Title: Mystery burns: Ahmedabad cops finally register FIR
Content:
Parvati Sarkar

AHMEDABAD: Narol police of the city on Wednesday registered a case of causing death by negligence against unknown persons in the case of 35-year-old Parvati Sarkar, who stepped into hot ash in Ganeshnagar on January 27 and died on February 28 due to severe burns.

Parvati’s son, Raja Sarkar, 19, a resident of Ganeshnagar, in his FIR with Narol police stated that his mother used to salvage scrap metal to earn a living. On January 27, she had gone to salvage metal near Ganeshnagar. She stepped into a sand heap and suffered severe burns near the Gyaspur Torrent power station, stated the FIR.

Parvati suffered 23% third-degree burns and was admitted to LG Hospital where she died on February 28. After this, police registered a case of accidental death on February 29 and began an inquiry in it.

During their inquiry, police learned that hot ash was dumped in the open which turned fatal for Parvati. However, the cops did not get CCTV footage so they are clueless about who dumped the ash which a byproduct of industrial units.

A police official said that they have collected 149 samples from various units and sent it to the FSL for further investigation.

This is not the only death in the area due to illegal dumping of hot ash.

In July 2018, 52-year-old Salma Ansari succumbed to 57% third-degree burns suffered after the scooter she was pillion riding on slipped and she fell on to a heap of hot sand. The accident had taken place on June 22 that year. Her husband, Nizamuddin Ansari had also suffered severe burns. He is still struggling to get justice.

Salma’s case is also unsolved. She was in LG Hospital for a month. Police and the Gujarat pollution control board (GPCB) are yet to identify the culprit.

Title: What happened in MP is murder of democracy: Gehlot
Content:
Edited

Jaipur: Rajasthan chief minister Ashok Gehlot said on Wednesday that the political turmoil in neighbouring Madhya Pradesh amounted to the “murder of democracy”.

He was speaking to the media at the airport, where he had gone to receive the Madhya Pradesh Congress MLAs. Later, in a series of tweets he said, "What has happened in #MadhyaPradesh, it is murder of democracy . Entire nation is watching, how shamelessly #HorseTrading is being done. In which direction are they taking the nation? They will definitely be taught a lesson by the people when the time comes (sic).”

“Attempts are being made to threaten, intimidate, as the worst kind of tactics are being adopted. Such brazen abuse of power has never been seen. Entire Congress party is united, and we will together teach them a lesson,” he tweeted.

“Their attempts to destabilise elected govts are because of their money power… They are not talking about any ideology. They want to grab power on basis of huge amount of money they have hoarded (sic),” the CM tweeted.

“The biggest scam happening in the country is of electoral bonds,” Gehlot said, adding, “They have amassed huge amounts of money; people are being looted by creating a fear of CBI, ED, IT inquiries. Corruption is at its peak. On this money power, they are plotting to destabilise democratically elected governments.”

“The sooner the opportunists leave the party the better,” he said, a reference to Jyotiraditya Scindia’s exit from Congress. “The party gave so much… he held various posts for 17-18 years, was made an MP, a Union minister. The public will never forgive him,” he said in a tweet.

Title: DRI seizes 5.5 kg of gold worth over Rs 2cr
Content:
Vijayawada: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence ( DRI ) sleuths seized 5.5 kg of gold , which was being illegally transported from Coimbatore in Tamil Nadu to Vijayawada on a bus and arrested three persons on Wednesday.

Based on reliable intelligence, DRI sleuths intercepted a sleeper bus near Venkatachalam toll plaza in Nellore district on Tuesday. Searches inside the bus revealed two persons carrying gold concealed in their cloth belts. A third person was found carrying gold in a small handbag. The gold was seized and all three were arrested. Following interrogation, the three arrested admitted that the gold was smuggled into the country. The worth of the gold has been pegged at Rs 2.34 crore, according to the market value.

A case has been registered under Customs Act, 1962, Investigation in on to find out the source and destination of the smuggled gold and identify those involved in the smuggling racket, the additional director general of DRI said in a statement. tnn

Title: Lack of toddy tappers has hit palm feni production: GU docu
Content:
Panaji: Production of coconut feni has been on decline as very few toddy tappers, locally called ‘render’ are into various other trades today. Traditional toddy tapping requires the tapper to climb a coconut tree thrice a day— not an adventure many of the younger men from families traditionally into the craft, are willing to take up.

The draft policy document on feni production prepared by Goa University’s Goa Business School, highlights some of the problems involved in the production of coconut feni.

The draft feni policy states that the older generation of ‘renders’ continue in the strenuous profession with the help of their family members, but their activity is restricted to festive occasions in certain villages and towns.

There is an acute shortage of toddy tappers. The drastic drop in the number of toddy tappers has directly affected coconut feni production, says the policy document.

One of the other reasons toddy tapping has gone out of vogue with the passage of time, is because the fermented sap from the coconut palm is used for making other products such as palm sugar (jaggery) and vinegar, widely used in traditional Goan cuisine. These two products have apparently found more favour with those linked to their production, as they yield more revenue with smaller labour costs as compared to coconut feni production, notes the study.

The risk involved in scaling coconut trees has also contributed to the youth walking away from the toddy tapping profession. During the monsoon, climbing a coconut tree is a challenge.

“Moss growing on the trunk makes it slippery and the toddy tapper runs the risk of falling off the tree,” it says. Renders are not protected by any social security scheme.

The study also notes that being a toddy tapper is a short-lived occupation due to the high risk of developing health ailments. Constant climbing of trees puts tremendous stress on the knees, and toddy tappers develop orthopedic and joint problems that make it difficult for them to continue in the profession.

Title: Anantapur police arrest four criminals under PD Act
Content:
Tirupati: Anantapur police booked four notorious criminals accused in several murder, faction, cheating and robbery related cases, under the Preventive detention (PD) Act and sent them to remand to the Kadapa Central Prison on Wednesday.

According to Anantapur SP B Satya Yesu Babu, Glen Brigs of Guntakal town, Nanda Kishore of Anantapur town, L Lakki Reddy of Gooty and Sheik Baabjaan of CK Palle were arrested under the PD Act .

Brigs ran a fake education certificate racket and his network spreads across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. He has been running the racket since 1997 and is wanted in connection with more than 25 cases registered against him AP and Telangana. Recently, he was arrested and the police had seized cash, gold and other properties from his possession. Kishore stands accused in several murder cases, including five in the Anantapur district. Reddy is wanted in connection with several cases of robbery pending against him under various police station limits in Gooty. Shiek Baabjaan is a notorious murderer and the prime accused in as many as five murder cases.

Police booked them under the PD Act and sent them to remand at the Kadapa central prison on Wednesday.

Title: Bank puts Ganta’s assets on auction
Content:
Visakhapatnam: Former TDP minister and present Visakha North MLA Ganta Srinivasa Rao’s property in Triveni Towers in Balayya Sastry Layout is set to be auctioned by the Indian Bank, after he defaulted on his loans. The auction would be held online on April 16. The Indian Bank has put an advertisement in media platforms with regard to it.

The bank has taken the action as per Securitisation and Reconstruction of Financial Assets and Enforcement of Security Interest Act, 2002, Rule No 6 (2), 8(6) & 9(1) under Security Interest (Enforcement Rules) 2002. The auction notice states that nine persons and institutions, including former minister Ganta Srinivasa Rao, M/S Pratusha Resources and Infra Private Limited , Pratyusha Estates Private Limited, Pratyusha Global Trade Private Limited, P Raja Rao have taken loan and mortgaged nine assets, including Ganta Srinivasa Rao’s property in Triveni Towers in Balayya Sastry Layout.

By September 30 of 2016, the loan amount was Rs 141.68 crore and it has gone up to Rs 220.66 crore. The properties were seized on December 27, 2016 and Febraury 21 of 2017. The properties are now up for auction.

Title: Academic calendar announced for all state schools
Content:
Ahmedabad: The state education department on Wednesday announced a tentative academic calendar for all schools in Gujarat that are affiliated to the state board.

According to the proposed schedule, the first academic session will be of 113 days while the second will be of 117 days. The new academic year, 2020-21, is to begin from April 20. The summer vacation will be from May 4 to June 7. The academic session will continue from June 7 to November 11. Exams will be conducted by the state from October 1 to October 10.

The state education department recently announced that all schools in Gujarat will follow centralized assessment for sessional, annual, and periodic exams across all grades from 3-12 that will be conducted by GSHSEB and GCERT.

The Diwali vacation will be from November 12 to December 2. The second academic session will begin on December 3.

Schools are to complete the course curriculum by March 14, 2021, following which exams will be held from March 15. The evaluation of exam papers is to be completed by March 31. The 2021-22 academic year is to begin from April 1, 2021.

Title: Ex-MLA Ramesh Babu deserts TDP, lashes out at Naidu
Content:
Visakhapatnam: TDP in Visakhapatnam city and district is facing rough weather with district president and former MLA Panchakarla Ramesh Babu resigning from the post and party membership on Wednesday.

Observers said TDP president N Chandrababu Naidu ’s opposition to the state government’s move to elevate Visakhapatnam as executive capital had upset Ramesh Babu.

Panchakarla Ramesh Babu started his political career with Chiranjeevi’s Praja Rajyam Party and won elections from Pendurthi assembly segment in 2009. He contested from Yalamanchili after joining TDP following the division of the state and won the election. He lost the elections last year from the same segment.

Ramesh Babu announced his resignation in a media conference held at his residence here on Wednesday and showed the letter sent to TDP national president Naidu. “Vizag has given me so much. Not only paved a platform for my business and also my political career. I came here for livelihood. But I have developed a bond with this city. There is no need to oppose Vizag as executive capital. I conveyed this to TDP president Naidu but he insisted me to carry out agitations for Amaravati , which I have not done,” Ramesh said.

He asked Naidu why he had not discussed the party’s poor show in the assembly elections held last year. He alleged there was no place for persons working sincerely for the party. Taking up the cause of Amaravati farmers is genuine but what about backward districts in north Andhra, he asked.

TDP has insulted the feelings of the north Andhra people, he accused. He would not join any party now and discuss it with his followers before taking any decision, Ramesh Babu said.

Title: 52-year-old govt teacher sets herself ablaze
Content:
Vijayawada: A 52-year-old government teacher committed suicide by setting herself ablaze at her residence at Kanchikacherla in Krishna district on Tuesday night. The incident, however, came to light on Wednesday morning. Police claimed that E Nagamani, a government teacher at Veerullapadu, was alone in the house when the incident took place, adding that she was suffering from both physical and mental health issues.

Police said that Nagamani, whose parents have passed away, was separated 20 years ago. Her daughter was married and stays in Machilipatnam. Srihari Babu, the Kanchikacherla SI, said Nagamani was diabetic and was on insulin . “Our investigation has revealed that she had depression and other health issues.” Nagamani doused herself in petrol before setting herself on fire .

The incident took place around midnight and the body was discovered by the domestic help on Wednesday morning. Police have ruled out suspicious death and stated that it was a case of suicide. However, the police did not recover any suicide letter from the crime scene.

Srihari Babu said that they have registered a case under Section 174 of CrPC and shifted the body to a government hospital for autopsy. The police recorded statements of Nagamani’s family members, neighbours and colleagues.

Title: Chittoor police destroy 20,000L of illicit liquor
Content:
Tirupati: Following a state-wide crackdown on the sale of illicit liquor, Chittoor police accompanied by sleuths from prohibition and excise department conducted raids at several places across the district and destroyed 20,000 litres of illicit liquor on Wednesday.

According to Chittoor SP S Senthil Kumar, nearly 400 cops, including additional SP K Krishnarjuna Rao, one probationary DSP, 10 police inspectors, 40 SIs and 300 police personnel along with 150 personnel from the prohibition and excise department, conducted raids at several places under Chittoor Taluk limits, Gudipala, Palasamudram, Nagari, Karvetinagaram, Vijayapuram, Kalikiri police station limits since 4 am.

Besides destroying 20,000 litres of illicit liquor, police arrested 12 persons and registered 15 cases.

Kumar warned people to refrain from distributing liquor, money and other freebies to influence voters during the election season. ‘‘The police department will act tough and not tolerate any attempt to disturb the peace in society. We are striving to conduct free and fair elections to the urban local bodies, panchayat raj and municipal polls”, he asserted.

Meanwhile, the district police carried out similar raids and destroy thousands of litres of arrack stocked across Anantapur district on Wednesday.

Title: Nath at helm, MLAs hope to save MP govt
Content:
Jaipur: The Congress hopes to save its government in Madhya Pradesh as chief minister Kamal Nath is considered as a master in the game of throne and not a pushover.

The Congress central leadership, which is in disarray, had been woken up from its deep slumber from the rude shock of Scindia’s rebellion is now preparing for a show down.

The Madhya Pradesh Congress which had gathered its MLAs in Jaipur is preparing for a fight back as it thinks that the MLAs which had gone to Bangalore are not all necessarily with Scindia especially after he joined the BJP.

The MLAs, who reached Jaipur by a special Indigo flight, were taken to the resorts in three luxury buses with VIP security. While two buses went to Buena Vista, one went to Tree House resort, about 20km from the former. Both the resorts are tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city with policeman guarding the way.

A Congress leader said, “A faction within the Congress is all right but leaving the party and joining the BJP may not be palatable to many MLAs.”

He claimed that they were tricked by the BJP by taking them for a trip and confined them to a resort in Bengaluru.”

“Scindia may get away with a Rajya Sabha seat and a plum post in the Union ministry but what will happen to these MLAs who had to resign from their assembly seats as they do not have the numbers to overcome the anti-defection law. Many of them may not even return to the assembly in the bypoll after this ‘betrayal’ will naturally prevail on them when they vote in the assembly.”

In the meanwhile, the MLAs have been lodged at two a luxury resorts on the outskirt with senior Congress leaders including Mukul Wasnik and Harish Rawat joining them at Buena Vista.

The Congress government in Rajasthan have been playing the role of host very dutifully even during the Maharashtra crisis where the party was able to defeat the machinations of the BJP and forming a coalition government with Shiv Sena. It hopes to repeat the same.

Title: SBI slashes deposit rates to below 6%, lowest since ’04
Content:
Mumbai: State Bank of India has cut deposit rates to its lowest level since 2004 and has done away with the minimum balance requirement for all its 44.5 crore savings accounts . The bank also trimmed interest rates on savings deposits by 25 basis points and cut the interest rate on loans by 10 bps (100 bps = 1 percentage point).

Following the reduction in fixed deposit rates, the highest return offered by SBI is 5.9% on deposits above a year. The last time FD rates were below 6% was in August 2004. The bank’s reduction in its marginal cost of lending rate (MCLR) by 10 basis points will bring down home loan rates for those who borrowed before October 2019.

SBI had reintroduced the minimum balance charges in April 2017 after five years of waiving it. The penalty for not maintaining minimum balance was the cause of much heartburn as the fines were levied on those who did not have enough money. In FY18 the bank collected Rs 2,400 crore by way of these charges which caused an uproar as those who were penalised included poor people who had opened accounts after demonetisation. Thereafter SBI revised the charges to Rs 5 to Rs 15 + taxes on non-maintenance of average monthly balances.

“We have been earning Rs 50–60 crore a month on these charges,” said Praveen Kumar Gupta, MD, State Bank of India.

He said that given the dissatisfaction over the charges the bank decided to waive them. The bank has also waived the charges for SMS alerts to customers. “The people who were being hit by these charges were the ones that needed to be financially included. We were not charging this in the past and we felt that these charges were something we could live without,” said Gupta.

On the reduction of the interest rates on savings account above Rs 1 lakh from 3.25% to 3%, Gupta said that a uniform 3% rate makes life easier for everyone.

Meanwhile, the reduction in the MCLR is the 10th consecutive cut in MCLR in FY 2019-20 and applies to the benchmark rate across all tenures. The bank’s one-year MCLR, against which home loans before October 2019 were pegged stands revised to be 7.75% from March 10, 2020. Consequently, EMIs on eligible home loan accounts (linked to MCLR) will get cheaper by around Rs 7 per 1 lakh on a 30-year loan. EMIs on car loans will also be reduced by Rs 5 per 1 lakh on a 7-year loan.

The cut in deposit rates comes on the back of a liquidity surge in the money markets. The crash in crude oil prices and an economic slowdown triggered by the coronavirus has raised hopes of RBI easing monetary policy. As a result, the yield on the benchmark 10-year debt slid as much as 13 basis points to 6.05% on Monday, a level last seen in 2009. SBI has brought its retail term deposit interest rates by 10 bps for ‘1 year & above’ tenor and 50 bps for deposits up to ‘45 days’. Bulk term deposit interest rates are reduced by 15 bps for deposits in ‘180 days & above’ tenors.

Title: Good to be on same team: Raje on Scindia
Content:
Jaipur: Former chief minister and BJP national vice-president Vasundhara Raje has welcomed her nephew Jyotiraditya Scindia ’s decision to join the BJP.

In a statement released here a day after Scindia switched sides by resigning from Congress , Raje said that her nephew has followed the high ideals of the legacy of her mother late Vijaya Raje Scindia.

“Jyotiraditya has followed the high ideals of the legacy of Vijaya Raje Scindia and has taken the decision in the country’s interest. I welcome this decision personally and politically,” she said on Wednesday.

Vasundhara Raje tweeted also saying it was good to be on the same team.

“If Rajmata Sahab was here today, she would be elated to see you put the nation first. I admire your strength of character and courage. It’s good to be on the same team. Welcome to the BJP,” she tweeted.

Jyotiraditya Scindia’s grandmother Vijaya Raje Scindia was one of the founding members of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).

Raje is younger sister of Madhavrao Scindia, father of Jyotiraditya Scindia. Madhavrao, who died in a plane crash in September 2001, was a Congressman. He was railway minister from 1986 to 1989 in the Rajiv Gandhi government and later civil aviation minister in the PV Narasimha Rao government.

Title: YSRC will win by a landslide: Nagi Reddy
Content:
Vijayawada: Vice-chairman of Andhra Pradesh Agricultural Mission, MVS Nagi Reddy has said the YSRC government’s welfare schemes and good governance would bear results and it would win a landslide victory in the ensuing local body polls.

Speaking to the media, here on Wednesday, Nagi Reddy said implementation of English medium from primary level and Disha Act are being discussed by Telangana, Maharashtra and Delhi governments as they want to emulate the moves.

“The government’s policies have been effective and elicited good response. This will have a telling effect on the polls,” he said. Chief minister YS Jaganmohan has Reddy fulfilled almost 90% of the election promises in just nine months of his tenure, he said, adding “Right from the beginning, our government has given importance to agriculture sector and farmers’ welfare. In the first budget session, Rs 28,866.23 crore was allocated for agriculture that is over 12% of the total budget.”

Title: Telangana: Passerby dies in bid to settle accident row
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: A road rage incident between a two-wheeler rider and a car driver ended in the death of a person, who intervened in their fight, at Hayathnagar on Tuesday night.

S Paramesh, 30, who intervened in the road rage incident, was allegedly abducted, put in the car by the driver, reportedly in an inebriated state, and driven away. However, a little later, the car was involved in an accident and Paramesh died in Hayathnagar.

Around 8pm on Tuesday, Paramesh and two others were travelling in an auto trolley on Kuntloor road. They came across a fight between a two-wheeler rider and two persons — Satish and Prasad— travelling in a car, Hayathnagar police said.

The trio halted the auto and intervened to stop the fight.

Paramesh and his associate Raju reportedly allowed the two-wheeler rider to leave the place. That annoyed the car occupants, who were already drunk and picked up an argument with Paramesh and Raju, police added. “They dragged Parmesh and Raju into their car and asked them to show where the two-wheeler driver had gone. They thrashed Paramesh inside the car,’’ Hayathnagar inspector K Satish said.

The car driver, who was reportedly driving at high speed, to avoid a head-on collision with another vehicle, veered it to one side and the car overturned. Paramesh suffered severe injuries, while others escaped with injuries, police said.

He was rushed to Osmania Hospital, where he succumbed while undergoing treatment late on Tuesday, Satish said.

Paramesh, who used to work at a door manufacturing company, was a resident of RK Nagar in Hayathnagar. He was heading home when the incident happened.

After the accident, according to police, the accused, both car drivers, fled from the location, abandoning their car.

Based on the car registration details and information provided by Raju, the two were booked under Sections 304 II (culpable homicide not amounting to murder), 336 (Act endangering life or personal safety of others), 342 (Punishment for wrongful confinement), 363 ( Punishment for kidnapping) and 323 (Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt) of the IPC and taken into custody on Wednesday. As the accused had fled from the location, police claimed that they could not measure their blood alcohol count (BAC).

Title: Ramayapatnam project likely to be carried out in three phases
Content:
Ongole: In what could be a major boon for the development of backward Prakasam district, the state government is giving final touches to the Ramayapatnam port construction plans. The state cabinet had recently gave its nod for the development of the port in the government sector.

The state government had already received the Detailed Projected Report (DPR) from Rites consultancy agency which put the project cost at Rs 10,000 crore. Sources said the port project would be taken up in three phases to avoid financial burden on the exchequer. They added that bringing the first phase of the port into operational itself is expected to make the project self-reliant.

Ramayapatnam port is likely to handle massive exports from the granite industry in the district and also tobacco exports from the neighbouring Guntur district. At present, granite and tobacco industries are dependent on Krishnapatnam and Chennai ports.

The state government directed the district administration to set its focus on the acquisition of the land for the port project. The district administration has already readied about 540 acres of land against the total requirement of 3,600 acres and is readying plans to acquire the remaining land in next 3-4 months. “Since majority of the lands are dry lands, farmers were willing to give it up in return for decent compensation. We are negotiating with the farmers to strike the deals,” said a senior official.

The state government has already set up Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) to rope in global agencies to take part in the development of the port. Sources said that the government would go for global tenders after securing the environmental clearances from the Centre.

Title: AAP to ready candidates’ list soon
Content:
Visakhapatnam: In spite of fund and manpower crunch, the Aam Aadmi Party is set to finalise its candidate list for the upcoming Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation polls within a day or two. Officer bearers, however, confirmed that they will not field candidates in all the 98 wards of the city.

AAP did not contest from any seats in the district in the 2019 Lok Sabha and assembly polls. The party had contested for the last time in the 2014 Lok Sabha and assembly polls. In 2014 the party nominated candidates for two Lok Sabha constituencies – Araku and Visakhapatnam – and for five assembly constituencies – Vizag East, Vizag South, Vizag West, Gajuwaka and Araku.

Following the AAP sweeping the recent Delhi assembly election, office bearers of the party decided to fight the GVMC election.

AAP set up an office in Visakhapatnam on February 23, 2014 before the Lok Sabha polls and within a few months had a support base of around 380 volunteers. But within a year the number of active volunteers had fallen to 10.

Title: Bombay high court to medical council: Do online games like PUBG affect kids?
Content:
Bombay high court (ANI photo)

MUMBAI: The Bombay high court on Wednesday sought Medical Council of India (MCI)’s reply on whether online games such as PlayerUnknown’s Battlegrounds ( PUBG ) have an adverse effect on children .

Hearing a PIL by a 12-year-old Ahad Nizam to ban the game, a bench of Acting Chief Justice Bhushan Dharmadhikari and Justice Nitin Borkar was informed by his father, advocate Tanvir, the game has 250 million downloads and that children are exposed to 16 such games.

Government pleader Poornima Kantharia said PUBG is not allowed to be played by any school in the state. “At home, he should have parental control on his own child,” she said.

Advocate Rui Rodrigues, for the ministry of electronics and information technology, said the petitioner has rushed to court without following the procedure for grievance redressal under the I-T Act, 2000. “You may have the procedure but if there are 15-16 such games that have unwanted and unwarranted influence on children, does the government of India have material to show that playing these games has an adverse effect on a child?” the ACJ asked. Nizam submitted there are internet de-addiction institutes in cities such as London and that MCI is a respondent to the PIL. Posting the hearing after three weesk, the judges said in this situation it is better if MCI files its reply.

An intervention plea was also filed by two law students and PUBG players from Nagpur, through advocate Sushil Gaglani, saying a ban will infringe upon their fundamental right to play video games.

Title: Vontimitta temple set for Rama Navami
Content:
TTD EO Anil Kumar Singhal releases the poster for the annual Brahmotsavams at Vontimitta temple in Kadapa dist... Read More

Tirupati: Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams executive officer Anil Kumar Singhal on Wednesday inspected ongoing arrangements for the annual Brahmotsavams festival to be held at Sri Kodanda Rama Swamy temple at Vontimitta in Kadapa district from April 2.

After the bifurcation of the state and the ancient Bhadrachalam Temple going to Telangana, the Vontimitta temple was chosen by the erstwhile Andhra Pradesh state government as the state venue for the annual Sri Rama Navami festivities. Following state government’s directive, TTD took over administrative control of the Vontimitta temple and funded its development.

With the Sri Rama Navami festival to be observed on April 2, TTD top brass—led by the EO, JEO P Basant Kumar, CVSO Gopinath Jatti and other senior officials—and Kadapa district collector CH Hari Kiran, inspected the ongoing arrangements at the temple.

Speaking to reporters, Singhal said “The CM has consented to take part in the Sita Rama Kalyanam to be observed on April 7.

The arrangements for this year’s annual Brahmotsavams will be better than last year’s,” the EO asserted.

Later, the TTD EO along with JEO Basant Kumar released the annual Brahmotsavams posters and inspected the development work at the temple.

Title: Tirupati inspector in ACB net
Content:
Tirupati: A police inspector was arrested by anti-corruption bureau sleuths in connection with a disproportionate assets case registered against him in Tirupati on Wednesday.

According to a press note released by PSR Anjaneyulu, DG-ACB, Vijayawada, the accused identified as K Venkatappa joined the police force as a sub-inspector in 1996. Later, he was promoted as a circle inspector and worked at the command control centre at the Tirupati urban police district.

During the raids carried out at his residences, ACB unearthed a house site purchased at Tiruchanoor Harijanawada in 2008, a G+2 house at MR Palli, purchased in the name of his wife in 2013, and assets jointly held by the couple that included an under construction G+4 house at MR Palli in Tirupati, three house sites at Avilala purchased in 2009 and 2014 and two agricultural plots purchased in 2011.

ACB sleuths also found two two wheelers, fixed deposits worth Rs 9 lakh, 160 grams of gold worth approximately Rs 4 lakh and bank balance of Rs 1.25 lakh.

Title: Officials review prep for Class-X exams
Content:
Joint collector L Siva Sankar holds a review meeting at the collectorate in Visakhapatnam on Wednesday

Visakhapatnam: Joint collector L Siva Sankar has asked district officials to make foolproof arrangements for Class-X public examinations that will commence from March 31.

The joint collector held a review meeting with district education officials here at the collectorate on Wednesday. Siva Sankar said 57,411 students will appear for examinations at 251 examination centres in the district. The joint collector asked officials to ensure provision of drinking water and other basic amenities at the centres. District education officer B Lingeswara Reddy spoke about the arrangements.

According to officials, Section 144 would be imposed at centres. The APSRTC will ply special buses along these routes.

Flying and sitting squads will be deployed to oversee the examinations. The transport department will provide vehicles for the transport of question papers to centres. The Eastern Power Distribution Company Limited has been requested for uninterrupted power supply to the centres.

Title: ‘Our loss, will be another party’s gain’
Content:
Jaipur: Contrary to other Congress leaders who have openly criticised Jyotiraditya Scindia for quitting the party and joining BJP, tourism minister Vishvendra Singh extended best wishes to the 49-year-old for his 'new endeavour'. Singh wished Scindia on Twitter.

“It is sad to see @JM_Scindia ji move on from the congress party. Our loss, will be another party's gain. I knew his father well, who was instrumental in getting my first congress ticket from #Nadbai Vidhan Sabha. I wish Scindia Jr. Sahib the very best for his new endeavour,” he tweeted on Wednesday.

“I am sure, that in the true spirit of the #Scindia family, he will continue to serve the Nation with utmost dedication and love,” the prominent Jat leader said. PTI

Title: Self-help groups to get govt backing to develop business
Content:
